meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to make provisions in respect of copyright and related rights and for connected purposes.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title and interpretation

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Copyright Ordinance.
The tables showing the provisions defining expressions used in Part II and Part III are set out in sections 199 and 239 respectively.

division.name: D1
division.heading: Subsistence, Ownership and Duration of Copyright

section.name: s2
section.heading: Copyright and copyright works

subsection.leadIn: Copyright is a property right which subsists in accordance with this Part in the following descriptions of work—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: original literary, dramatic, musical or artistic works;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sound recordings, films, broadcasts or cable programmes; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the typographical arrangement of published editions.

subsection.def: In this Part copyright work (版權作品) means a work of any of those descriptions in which copyright subsists.

subsection.content: Copyright does not subsist in a work unless the requirements of this Part with respect to qualification for copyright protection are met (see section 177 and the provisions referred to there).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Rights subsisting in copyright works

subsection.content: The owner of the copyright in a work of any description has the exclusive right to do the acts specified in Division II as the acts restricted by the copyright in a work of that description.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to certain descriptions of copyright work the following rights conferred by Division IV (moral rights) subsist in favour of the author or director of the work, whether or not he is the owner of the copyright—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 89 (right to be identified as author or director); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 92 (right to object to derogatory treatment of work).

division.crossHeading: Descriptions of work and related provisions

section.name: s4
section.heading: Literary, dramatic and musical works

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: dramatic work (戲劇作品) includes a work of dance or mime;

def.name: LiteraryWork
def.leadIn: literary work (文學作品) means any work, other than a dramatic or musical work, which is written, spoken or sung, and accordingly includes—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a computer program; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: preparatory design material for a computer program;

subsection.def: musical work (音樂作品) means a work consisting of music, exclusive of any words or action intended to be sung, spoken or performed with the music.

subsection.content: Copyright does not subsist in a literary, dramatic or musical work unless and until it is recorded, in writing or otherwise; and references in this Part to the time at which such a work is made are to the time at which it is so recorded.

It is immaterial for the purposes of subsection (2) whether the work is recorded by or with the permission of the author; and where it is not recorded by the author, nothing in that subsection affects the question whether copyright subsists in the record as distinct from the work recorded.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Artistic works
section.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: ArtisticWork
def.leadIn: artistic work (藝術作品) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a graphic work, photograph, sculpture or collage, irrespective of artistic quality;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a work of architecture being a building or a model for a building; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a work of artistic craftsmanship;

def.name: GraphicWork
def.leadIn: graphic work (平面美術作品) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any painting, drawing, diagram, map, chart or plan; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any engraving, etching, lithograph, woodcut or similar work;

section.def: photograph (照片) means a recording of light or other radiation on any medium on which an image is produced or from which an image may by any means be produced, and which is not part of a film;
sculpture (雕塑品) includes a cast or model made for purposes of sculpture.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Sound recordings

def.name: SoundRecording
def.leadIn: In this Part sound recording (聲音紀錄) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a recording of sounds, from which the sounds may be reproduced; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a recording of the whole or any part of a literary, dramatic or musical work, from which sounds reproducing the work or part may be produced,

def.continued: regardless of the medium on which the recording is made or the method by which the sounds are reproduced or produced.

subsection.content: Copyright does not subsist in a sound recording which is, or to the extent that it is, a copy taken from a previous sound recording.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Films

subsection.def: In this Part film (影片) means a recording on any medium from which a moving image may by any means be produced.

subsection.content: The sound-track accompanying a film is to be treated as part of the film for the purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to the generality of subsection (2), where that subsection applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: references in this Part to showing a film include playing the film sound-track to accompany the film; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: references to playing a sound recording do not include playing the film sound-track to accompany the film.

subsection.content: Copyright does not subsist in a film which is, or to the extent that it is, a copy taken from a previous film.
Nothing in this section affects any copyright subsisting in a film sound-track as a sound recording. (Added 16 of 2022 s. 4)

section.name: s8
section.heading: Broadcasts

def.name: Broadcast
def.leadIn: In this Part a broadcast (廣播) means a transmission by wireless telegraphy of sounds or of visual images and sounds or of representations thereof which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is capable of being lawfully received by members of the public in Hong Kong or elsewhere; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is transmitted for presentation to members of the public in Hong Kong or elsewhere,

def.continued: otherwise than through a service for making works or fixations of performances available to the public. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 5)

subsection.content: An encrypted transmission is regarded as capable of being lawfully received by members of the public in Hong Kong or elsewhere only if decoding equipment has been made available to members of the public in Hong Kong or elsewhere by or with the authority of the person making the transmission or the person providing the contents of the transmission.

subsection.leadIn: References in this Part to the person making a broadcast, broadcasting a work, or including a work in a broadcast are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the person transmitting the programme, if he has responsibility to any extent for its contents; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to any person providing the programme who makes with the person transmitting it the arrangements necessary for its transmission,

subsection.continued: and references in this Part to a programme, in the context of broadcasting, are to any item included in a broadcast.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Part the place from which a broadcast is made is the place where, under the control and responsibility of the person making the broadcast, the programme-carrying signals are introduced into an uninterrupted chain of communication (including, in the case of a satellite transmission, the chain leading to the satellite and down towards the earth).
References in this Part to the reception of a broadcast include reception of a broadcast relayed by means of a telecommunications system. (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)
Copyright does not subsist in a broadcast which infringes, or to the extent that it infringes, the copyright in another broadcast or in a cable programme.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Cable programmes

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: cable programme (有線傳播節目) means any item included in a cable programme service;

def.name: CableProgrammeService
def.leadIn: cable programme service (有線傳播節目服務) means a service which consists wholly or mainly in the lawful sending by any person, by means of a telecommunications system (whether run by himself or by any other person), of sounds, visual images, other information or any combination of them either— (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for lawful reception, otherwise than by wireless telegraphy, at 2 or more places in Hong Kong or elsewhere, whether they are so sent for simultaneous reception or at different times in response to requests made by different users of the service; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for lawful reception, by whatever means, at a place in Hong Kong or elsewhere for the purposes of their being presented there either to members of the public or to any group of persons,

def.continued: and includes such a service that has as a component a multipoint microwave distribution system, but does not include the services excepted under subsection (2);

subsection.def: sounds (聲音), for the purposes of the exclusion in subsection (2)(a), means speech or music or both except that they do not include, in relation to any telecommunications system, speech providing information for the purpose of facilitating the use of a telecommunications service provided by means of that system; (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)
visual images (影像), for the purposes of the exclusion in subsection (2)(a), means visual images which are such that sequences of them may be seen as moving pictures.

subsection.leadIn: The following are excepted from the definition of cable programme service—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a service (such as the services commonly known as video conferencing and video telephony) which consists wholly or mainly in the transmission of sounds or visual images or both by any person if it is an essential feature of the service that, while they are being transmitted, there will or may be transmitted from each place of reception, by means of the telecommunications system or (as the case may be) the part of it by means of which they are transmitted, sounds or visual images or both for reception by that person; (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a service for making works or fixations of performances available to the public, but excluding a service in which the transmission of moving visual representational images is an essential feature (such as the service commonly known as video-on-demand); (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 6)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the running by a broadcaster of a telecommunications system in the case of which every transmission made by it is either— (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a transmission, by wireless telegraphy, from a transmitting station for general reception of sounds, visual images or signals serving for the impartation (whether as between persons and persons, things and things or persons and things) of any matter otherwise than in the form of sounds or visual images; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a transmission within a single set of premises of sounds, visual images or such signals which are to be or have been so transmitted;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the running of a telecommunications system in the case of which the only agency involved in the transmission of things thereby transmitted is light and the things thereby transmitted are so transmitted as to be capable of being received or perceived by the eye and without more; (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: the running by a person of a telecommunications system which is not connected to another telecommunications system and in the case of which all the apparatus comprised therein is situated either— (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: on a single set of premises in single occupation (other than a service operated as part of the amenities provided for residents or inmates of premises run as a business); or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the running by a single individual of a telecommunications system which is not connected to another telecommunications system and in the case of which— (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: all the apparatus comprised therein is under his control; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: everything transmitted by it that is speech, music and other sounds, visual images, signals serving for the impartation (whether as between persons and persons, things and things or persons and things) of any matter otherwise than in the form of sounds or visual images, or signals serving for the actuation or control of machinery or apparatus is transmitted solely for his domestic purposes,

paragraph.continued: and references in paragraph (e) and this paragraph to another telecommunications system do not include references to such a system as is mentioned in paragraph (c) (whether run by a broadcaster or by any other person); or (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a business carried on by a person, the running, for the purposes of the business, of a telecommunications system which is not connected to another telecommunications system and with respect to which the following conditions are satisfied— (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that no person except the person carrying on the business is concerned in the control of the apparatus comprised in the system;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that nothing that is speech, music and other sounds, visual images, signals serving for the impartation (whether as between persons and persons, things and things or persons and things) of any matter otherwise than in the form of sounds or visual images, or signals serving for the actuation or control of machinery or apparatus is transmitted by the system by way of rendering a service to another;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: that, in so far as sounds or visual images are transmitted by the system, they are not transmitted for the purpose of their being heard or seen by persons other than the person carrying on the business or any employees of his engaged in the conduct thereof;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: that, in so far as signals serving for the impartation (whether as between persons and persons, things and things or persons and things) of any matter otherwise than in the form of sounds or visual images are transmitted by the system, they are not transmitted for the purpose of imparting matter otherwise than to the person carrying on the business, any employees of his engaged in the conduct thereof or things used in the course of the business and controlled by him; and

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: that, in so far as signals of speech, music and other sounds are transmitted by the system, they are not transmitted for the purpose of actuating or controlling machinery or apparatus used otherwise than in the course of the business.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may by order amend subsection (2) so as to remove exceptions, subject to such transitional provision as appears to him to be appropriate. (Amended 22 of 1999 s. 3)

References in this Part to the inclusion of a cable programme or work in a cable programme service are to its transmission as part of the service; and references to the person including it are to the person providing the service.

subsection.leadIn: Copyright does not subsist in a cable programme if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is included in a cable programme service by reception and immediate re-transmission of a broadcast; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it infringes, or to the extent that it infringes, the copyright in another cable programme or in a broadcast.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Published editions

subsection.def: In this Part published edition (已發表版本), in the context of copyright in the typographical arrangement of a published edition, means a published edition of the whole or any part of one or more literary, dramatic or musical works.

subsection.content: Copyright does not subsist in the typographical arrangement of a published edition if, or to the extent that, it reproduces the typographical arrangement of a previous edition.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Authorship of work

subsection.def: In this Part author (作者), in relation to a work, means the person who creates it.

subsection.leadIn: That person is taken to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a sound recording, the producer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a film, the producer and the principal director;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a broadcast, the person making the broadcast (see section 8(3)) or, in the case of a broadcast which relays another broadcast by reception and immediate re-transmission, the person making that other broadcast;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in the case of a cable programme, the person providing the cable programme service in which the programme is included;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in the case of the typographical arrangement of a published edition, the publisher.

subsection.content: In the case of a literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work which is computer-generated, the author is taken to be the person by whom the arrangements necessary for the creation of the work are undertaken.

For the purposes of this Part a work is of unknown authorship (作者不為人知) if the identity of the author is unknown or, in the case of a work of joint authorship, if the identity of none of the authors is known. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019)

For the purposes of this Part the identity of an author is regarded as unknown if it is not possible for a person to ascertain his identity by reasonable inquiry; but if his identity is once known it shall not subsequently be regarded as unknown.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Works of joint authorship

subsection.def: In this Part a work of joint authorship (合作作品) means a work made by the collaboration of 2 or more authors in which the contribution of each author is not distinct from that of the other author or authors.

subsection.content: A film is treated as a work of joint authorship unless the producer and the principal director are the same person.
A broadcast is treated as a work of joint authorship in a case where more than one person is to be taken as making the broadcast (section 8(3)).
References in this Part to the author of a work are, except as otherwise provided, construed in relation to a work of joint authorship as references to all the authors of the work.

section.name: s13
section.heading: First ownership of copyright
section.content: The author of a work is the first owner of any copyright in it, subject to sections 14, 15 and 16.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Employee works

subsection.leadIn: Where a literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work, or a film, is made by an employee in the course of his employment, his employer is the first owner of any copyright in the work subject to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any agreement to the contrary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subsection (2).

subsection.content: Subject to any agreement to the contrary, where such work is exploited by his employer or by someone else with the employer’s permission in a way that could not reasonably have been contemplated by the employer and the employee at the time of making the work, the employer shall pay an award to the employee in respect of such exploitation at such amount as agreed between the employer and the employee or failing an agreement, as determined by the Copyright Tribunal.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Commissioned works

subsection.content: Where a work is made on the commission of a person and there is an agreement between the author and the commissioner of the work which expressly provides for the entitlement to the copyright, copyright in the commissioned work belongs to the person who is entitled to the copyright under the agreement.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding subsection (1) and sections 13 and 103, the person who commissioned the work—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has an exclusive licence to exploit the commissioned work for all purposes that could reasonably have been contemplated by the author and the person who commissioned the work at the time the work was commissioned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has the power to restrain any exploitation of the commissioned work for any purpose against which he could reasonably take objection.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Government copyright, etc.
section.content: Sections 13, 14 and 15 do not apply to Government copyright or Legislative Council copyright (see sections 182 and 184) or to copyright which subsists by virtue of section 188 (copyright of certain international organizations).

section.name: s17
section.heading: Duration of copyright in literary, dramatic, musical or artistic works

subsection.content: The following provisions have effect with respect to the duration of copyright in a literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work.
Copyright expires at the end of the period of 50 years from the end of the calendar year in which the author dies, subject as follows.

subsection.leadIn: If the work is of unknown authorship, copyright expires—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the end of the period of 50 years from the end of the calendar year in which the work was first made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if during that period the work is made available to the public, at the end of the period of 50 years from the end of the calendar year in which it is first so made available,

subsection.continued: subject as follows.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) applies if the identity of the author becomes known before the end of the period specified in subsection (3)(a) or (b).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3), making available to the public (向公眾提供) includes— (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019; 16 of 2022 s. 7)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a literary, dramatic or musical work, either or both of the following— (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 7)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: performance in public;
communication to the public; and (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 7)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an artistic work, any of the following— (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 7)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: exhibition in public;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a film including the work being shown in public;
communication to the public, (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 7)

subsection.continued: but in determining generally for the purposes of that subsection whether a work has been made available to the public no account is to be taken of any unauthorized act. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 7)

subsection.content: If the work is computer-generated the above provisions do not apply and copyright expires at the end of the period of 50 years from the end of the calendar year in which the work was made.

subsection.leadIn: The provisions of this section are adapted as follows in relation to a work of joint authorship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the reference in subsection (2) to the death of the author is to be construed—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: if the identity of all the authors is known, as a reference to the death of the last of them to die; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the identity of one or more of the authors is known and the identity of one or more others is not, as a reference to the death of the last whose identity is known; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reference in subsection (4) to the identity of the author becoming known is to be construed as a reference to the identity of any of the authors becoming known.

subsection.content: This section does not apply to Government copyright or Legislative Council copyright (see sections 182 to 184) or to copyright which subsists by virtue of section 188 (copyright of certain international organizations).

section.name: s18
section.heading: Duration of copyright in sound recordings

subsection.content: The following provisions have effect with respect to the duration of copyright in a sound recording.

subsection.leadIn: Copyright expires—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the end of the period of 50 years from the end of the calendar year in which it is made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if during that period it is released, 50 years from the end of the calendar year in which it is released,

subsection.continued: subject as follows.

subsection.def: For the purposes of subsection (2) a sound recording is released (發行) when it is first published, played in public or communicated to the public; but in determining whether a sound recording has been released no account is to be taken of any unauthorized act. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019; 16 of 2022 s. 8)

section.name: s19
section.heading: Duration of copyright in films

subsection.content: The following provisions have effect with respect to the duration of copyright in a film.

subsection.leadIn: Copyright expires at the end of the period of 50 years from the end of the calendar year in which the death occurs of the last to die of the following persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the principal director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the author of the screenplay;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the author of the dialogue; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the composer of music specially created for and used in the film,

subsection.continued: subject as follows.

subsection.content: If the identity of one or more of the persons referred to in subsection (2)(a) to (d) is known and the identity of one or more others is not, the reference in that subsection to the death of the last of them to die is to be construed as a reference to the death of the last whose identity is known.

subsection.leadIn: If the identity of the persons referred to in subsection (2)(a) to (d) is unknown, copyright expires at—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the end of the period of 50 years from the end of the calendar year in which the film was made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if during that period the film is made available to the public, at the end of the period of 50 years from the end of the calendar year in which it is first so made available.

subsection.content: Subsections (2) and (3) apply if the identity of any of those persons becomes known before the end of the period specified in subsection (4)(a) or (b).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4), making available to the public (向公眾提供) includes either or both of the following— (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019; 16 of 2022 s. 9)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: showing in public;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: communicating to the public, (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 9)

subsection.continued: but in determining generally for the purposes of that subsection whether a film has been made available to the public no account is to be taken of any unauthorized act.

subsection.content: If in any case there is no person falling within subsection (2)(a) to (d) the above provisions do not apply and copyright expires at the end of the period of 50 years from the end of the calendar year in which the film was made.

For the purposes of this section the identity of any of the persons referred to in subsection (2)(a) to (d) is to be regarded as unknown if it is not possible for a person to ascertain his identity by reasonable inquiry; but if the identity of any such person is once known it shall not subsequently be regarded as unknown.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Duration of copyright in broadcasts and cable programmes

subsection.content: The following provisions have effect with respect to the duration of copyright in a broadcast or cable programme.

Copyright in a broadcast or cable programme expires at the end of the period of 50 years from the end of the calendar year in which the broadcast was made or the programme was included in a cable programme service, subject as follows.

Copyright in a repeat broadcast or cable programme expires at the same time as the copyright in the original broadcast or cable programme; and accordingly no copyright arises in respect of a repeat broadcast or cable programme which is broadcast or included in a cable programme service after the expiry of the copyright in the original broadcast or cable programme.
A repeat broadcast or cable programme means one which is a repeat either of a broadcast previously made or of a cable programme previously included in a cable programme service.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Duration of copyright in typographical arrangement of published editions
section.content: Copyright in the typographical arrangement of a published edition expires at the end of the period of 25 years from the end of the calendar year in which the edition was first published.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Rights of Copyright Owner

section.name: s22
section.heading: The acts restricted by copyright in a work

subsection.leadIn: The owner of the copyright in a work has, in accordance with the following provisions of this Division, the exclusive right to do the following acts in Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to copy the work (see section 23);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to issue copies of the work to the public (see section 24);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to rent copies of the work to the public (see section 25); (Replaced 15 of 2007 s. 5)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to perform, show or play the work in public (see section 27);

paragraph.name: fa
paragraph.content: to communicate the work to the public (see section 28A); (Added 16 of 2022 s. 10)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.text: to make an adaptation of the work or do any of the above in relation to an adaptation (see section 29),

subsection.continued: and those acts are referred to in this Part as the acts restricted by the copyright (受版權所限制的作為). (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019)

subsection.content: Copyright in a work is infringed by a person who without the licence of the copyright owner does, or authorizes another to do, any of the acts restricted by the copyright.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), in determining whether a person has authorized another person to do any of the acts restricted by the copyright in a work, the court may take into account all the circumstances of the case and, in particular—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the extent of that person’s power (if any) to control or prevent the infringement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the nature of the relationship (if any) between that person and that other person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether that person has taken any reasonable steps to limit or stop the infringement. (Added 16 of 2022 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: References in this Part to the doing of an act restricted by the copyright in a work are to the doing of it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the work as a whole or any substantial part of it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: either directly or indirectly,

subsection.continued: and it is immaterial whether any intervening acts themselves infringe copyright.

subsection.leadIn: This Division has effect subject to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the provisions of Division III (acts permitted in relation to copyright works); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provisions of Division VIII (provisions with respect to copyright licensing).

section.name: s23
section.heading: Infringement of copyright by copying

subsection.content: The copying of the work is an act restricted by the copyright in every description of copyright work; and references in this Part to copying and copies are construed as follows.
Copying of a work means reproducing the work in any material form. This includes storing the work in any medium by electronic means.
In relation to an artistic work copying includes the making of a copy in 3 dimensions of a 2-dimensional work and the making of a copy in 2 dimensions of a 3-dimensional work.

Copying in relation to a film, television broadcast or cable programme includes making a photograph of the whole or any substantial part of any image forming part of the film, broadcast or cable programme.
Copying in relation to the typographical arrangement of a published edition means making a facsimile copy of the arrangement.
Copying in relation to any description of work includes the making of copies which are transient or are incidental to some other use of the work.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Infringement by issue of copies to the public

subsection.content: The issue of copies of the work to the public is an act restricted by the copyright in every description of copyright work.

References in this Part to the issue of copies of a work to the public are to the act of putting into circulation copies not previously put into circulation, in Hong Kong or elsewhere, by or with the consent of the copyright owner.

subsection.leadIn: References in this Part to the issue of copies of a work to the public do not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any subsequent distribution, sale, hiring or loan of copies previously put into circulation (but see section 25: infringement by rental); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any subsequent importation of those copies into Hong Kong.

subsection.content: References in this Part to the issue of copies of a work include the issue of the original and the issue of copies in electronic form. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019)

section.name: s25
section.heading: Infringement by rental of work to the public

subsection.leadIn: The rental of copies of any of the following works to the public is an act restricted by the copyright in the work—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a computer program;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a sound recording;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a film;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a literary, dramatic or musical work included in a sound recording. (Replaced 15 of 2007 s. 6. Amended 16 of 2022 s. 11)

subsection.def: In this Part, subject to the following provisions of this section, rental (租賃) means making a copy of the work available for use, on terms that it will or may be returned, for direct or indirect economic or commercial advantage.

def.name: Rental
def.leadIn: The expression rental (租賃) does not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: making available for the purpose of public performance, playing or showing in public or communicating to the public; (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: making available for the purpose of exhibition in public; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: making available for on-the-spot reference use.

subsection.content: References in this Part to the rental of copies of a work include the rental of the original.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Infringement by performance, playing or showing of work in public

subsection.content: The performance of the work in public is an act restricted by the copyright in a literary, dramatic or musical work.

def.name: Performance
def.leadIn: In this Part performance (表演), in relation to a work—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: includes delivery in the case of lectures, addresses, speeches and sermons; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in general, includes any mode of visual or acoustic presentation, including presentation by means of a sound recording, film, broadcast or cable programme of the work.

subsection.content: The playing or showing of the work in public is an act restricted by the copyright in a sound recording, film, broadcast or cable programme.

Where copyright in a work is infringed by its being performed, played or shown in public by means of apparatus for receiving visual images or sounds transmitted by electronic means, the person by whom the visual images or sounds are sent, and in the case of a performance the performers, shall not be regarded as responsible for the infringement.

section.name: s28A
section.heading: Infringement by communicating to public

subsection.content: The communication of a work of any description to the public is an act restricted by the copyright in the work.

subsection.leadIn: References in this Part to the communication of a work to the public are references to the electronic communication of the work to the public, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the broadcasting of the work;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the inclusion of the work in a cable programme service; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the making available of the work to the public.

subsection.content: References in this Part to making a work available to the public are references to making the work available, by wire or wireless means, in such a way that members of the public in Hong Kong or elsewhere may access the work from a place and at a time individually chosen by them (such as by making works available through the Internet).
A person is to be regarded as having communicated a work to the public if the person has determined the content of the communication.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4), a person does not determine the content of a communication only because the person takes one or more steps for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: gaining access to what is made available by someone else in the communication; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: receiving the electronic transmission of which the communication consists.

statutoryNote.content: A person does not determine the content of a communication (in the form of a webpage) to the person only because the person clicks on a link to gain access to the webpage.

subsection.content: The mere provision of facilities by any person for enabling or facilitating the communication of a work to the public does not of itself constitute an act of communicating the work to the public.

statutoryNote.content: The provision of facilities that are primarily designed, produced or adapted to enable or facilitate direct access to a work protected by copyright without the permission of the copyright owner is not a mere provision of facilities referred to in this subsection.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, the mere fact that an act done by a person is not a communication of a work to the public under subsection (1) does not affect any liability (whether civil or criminal) the person may otherwise have for that act under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any rule of law.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Infringement by making adaptation or act done in relation to adaptation

subsection.content: The making of an adaptation of the work is an act restricted by the copyright in a literary, dramatic or musical work. For this purpose an adaptation is made when it is recorded, in writing or otherwise.

The doing of any of the acts specified in section 23, 24, 25, 27 or 28A, or subsection (1), in relation to an adaptation of the work is also an act restricted by the copyright in a literary, dramatic or musical work. For this purpose it is immaterial whether the adaptation has been recorded, in writing or otherwise, at the time the act is done. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 15)

def.name: Adaptation
def.leadIn: In this Part adaptation (改編本)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a literary work, other than a computer program, or dramatic work, means—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a translation of the work;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a version of a dramatic work in which it is converted into a non-dramatic work or, as the case may be, of a non-dramatic work in which it is converted into a dramatic work;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a version of the work in which the story or action is conveyed wholly or mainly by means of pictures in a form suitable for reproduction in a book, or in a newspaper, magazine or similar periodical;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: in relation to a musical work, means an arrangement or transcription of the work.

subsection.def: In relation to a computer program a translation (翻譯本) includes a version of the program in which it is converted into or out of a computer language or code or into a different computer language or code.

subsection.content: No inference is to be drawn from this section as to what does or does not amount to copying a work.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Secondary infringement: importing or exporting infringing copy
section.content: The copyright in a work is infringed by a person who, without the licence of the copyright owner, imports into Hong Kong or exports from Hong Kong, otherwise than for his private and domestic use, a copy of the work which is, and which he knows or has reason to believe to be, an infringing copy of the work.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Secondary infringement: dealing with infringing copy

subsection.leadIn: The copyright in a work is infringed by a person who, without the licence of the copyright owner— (Amended 64 of 2000 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: possesses for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business; (Replaced 64 of 2000 s. 2. Amended 15 of 2007 s. 7)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sells or lets for hire, or offers or exposes for sale or hire;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: exhibits in public or distributes for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business; or (Replaced 64 of 2000 s. 2. Amended 15 of 2007 s. 7)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: distributes (otherwise than for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business) to such an extent as to affect prejudicially the owner of the copyright, (Amended 64 of 2000 s. 2; 15 of 2007 s. 7)

subsection.continued: a copy of a work which is, and which he knows or has reason to believe to be, an infringing copy of the work.

subsection.content: It is immaterial for the purpose of subsection (1)(a) and (c) whether or not the trade or business consists of dealing in infringing copies of copyright works. (Added 64 of 2000 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(d), in determining whether any distribution of an infringing copy of a work is made to such an extent as to affect prejudicially the owner of the copyright, the court may take into account all the circumstances of the case and, in particular—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purpose of the distribution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the nature of the work, including its commercial value (if any);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount and substantiality of the portion copied (in relation to the work as a whole) that was distributed;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the mode of the distribution; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the economic prejudice (if any) caused to the owner of the copyright as a consequence of the distribution, including the effect of the distribution on the potential market for, or value of, the work. (Added 16 of 2022 s. 16)

section.name: s32
section.heading: Secondary infringement: providing means for making infringing copies

subsection.leadIn: Copyright in a work is infringed by a person who, without the licence of the copyright owner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: imports into Hong Kong or exports from Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: possesses for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business; or (Amended 64 of 2000 s. 3; 15 of 2007 s. 8)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: sells or lets for hire, or offers or exposes for sale or hire,

subsection.continued: an article specifically designed or adapted for making copies of that work, knowing or having reason to believe that it is to be used to make infringing copies.

subsection.content: Copyright in a work is infringed by a person who, without the licence of the copyright owner, transmits the work by means of a telecommunications system (otherwise than by communicating to the public), knowing or having reason to believe that infringing copies of the work will be made by means of the reception of the transmission in Hong Kong or elsewhere. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 17)

It is immaterial for the purpose of subsection (1)(c) whether or not the trade or business consists of dealing in articles specially designed or adapted for making copies of copyright works. (Added 64 of 2000 s. 3)

section.name: s33
section.heading: Secondary infringement: permitting use of premises for infringing performance

subsection.content: Where the copyright in a work is infringed by a performance at a place of public entertainment, any person who gave permission for that place to be used for the performance is also liable for the infringement unless when he gave permission he believed on reasonable grounds that the performance would not infringe copyright.

subsection.def: In this section place of public entertainment (公眾娛樂場所) includes premises which are occupied mainly for other purposes but are from time to time made available for hire for the purposes of public entertainment.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Secondary infringement: provision of apparatus for infringing performance, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Where copyright in a work is infringed by a public performance of the work, or by the playing or showing of the work in public, by means of apparatus for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: playing sound recordings;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: showing films; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: receiving visual images or sounds transmitted by electronic means,

subsection.continued: the persons specified in subsections (2) to (4) are also liable for the infringement.

subsection.leadIn: A person who supplied the apparatus, or any substantial part of it, is liable for the infringement if when he supplied the apparatus or part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he knew or had reason to believe that the apparatus was likely to be so used as to infringe copyright; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of apparatus whose normal use involves a public performance, playing or showing, he did not believe on reasonable grounds that it would not be so used as to infringe copyright.

subsection.content: An occupier of premises who gave permission for the apparatus to be brought onto the premises is liable for the infringement if when he gave permission he knew or had reason to believe that the apparatus was likely to be so used as to infringe copyright.

A person who supplied a copy of a sound recording or film used to infringe copyright is liable for the infringement if when he supplied it he knew or had reason to believe that what he supplied, or a copy made directly or indirectly from it, was likely to be so used as to infringe copyright.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Meaning of infringing copy

subsection.content: In this Part infringing copy (侵犯版權複製品), in relation to a copyright work, is to be construed in accordance with this section.
A copy of a work is an infringing copy if its making constituted an infringement of the copyright in the work in question.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it has been or is proposed to be imported into Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its making in Hong Kong would have constituted an infringement of the copyright in the work in question, or a breach of an exclusive licence agreement relating to that work.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 118 to 133 (criminal provisions) infringing copy (侵犯版權複製品) does not include a copy of a work—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that was lawfully made in the country, territory or area where it was made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that has been or is proposed to be imported into Hong Kong at any time after the expiration of 15 months beginning on the first day of publication of the work in Hong Kong or elsewhere; and (Amended 15 of 2007 s. 9)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: its making in Hong Kong would have constituted an infringement of the copyright in the work in question, or a breach of an exclusive licence agreement relating to that work,

subsection.continued: or a copy of an accessory work—

paragraph.content: that was lawfully made in the country, territory or area where it was made;
that has been or is proposed to be imported into Hong Kong; and
its making in Hong Kong would have constituted an infringement of the copyright in the work in question, or a breach of an exclusive licence agreement relating to that work.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of Division VII (proceedings relating to importation of infringing articles), infringing copy (侵犯版權複製品) does not include a copy of a work or a copy of an accessory work—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that was lawfully made in the country, territory or area where it was made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that has been or is proposed to be imported into Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: its making in Hong Kong would have constituted an infringement of the copyright in the work in question, or a breach of an exclusive licence agreement relating to that work.

subsection.leadIn: Where in any proceedings the question arises whether a copy of a work is an infringing copy and it is shown—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that it is a copy of the work; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that copyright subsists in the work or has subsisted at any time,

subsection.continued: it shall be presumed until the contrary is proved that the copy was made at a time when copyright subsisted in the work.

subsection.name: 6A
subsection.leadIn: Where, in any proceedings, a question arises as to whether a copy of a work that was lawfully made in the country, territory or area where it was made is an infringing copy by virtue only of subsection (3), and it is shown—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that a label or mark on the copy, the article in which the copy is embodied or the packaging or container in which the copy is packaged or contained indicates that the copy was made in a country, territory or area outside Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that a label or mark on the copy, the article in which the copy is embodied or the packaging or container in which the copy is packaged or contained indicates that distribution, sale or supply of the copy is prohibited in Hong Kong or restricted to countries, territories or areas outside Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: then, unless there is evidence to the contrary, the copy shall be presumed to have been imported into Hong Kong. (Added 15 of 2007 s. 9)

subsection.name: 6B
subsection.leadIn: In subsection (6A)(a)—
subsection.def: manufacturer’s code (製造者代碼) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Prevention of Copyright Piracy Ordinance (Cap. 544);
optical disc (光碟) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2(1) of the Prevention of Copyright Piracy Ordinance (Cap. 544). (Added 15 of 2007 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, infringing copy (侵犯版權複製品) includes a copy which is to be treated as an infringing copy by virtue of any of the following provisions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 35B(5) (imported copy not an infringing copy for purposes of section 35(3));

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 40B(5) (accessible copies made for persons with a print disability);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 40C(7) (accessible copies made by specified bodies for persons with a print disability);

paragraph.name: ca
paragraph.content: section 40CA(11) (accessible copies made by specified bodies for export or supply); (Added 10 of 2020 s. 3)

paragraph.name: cb
paragraph.content: section 40CB(7) (accessible copies imported or obtained by specified bodies); (Added 10 of 2020 s. 3)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 40D(2) (intermediate copies possessed by specified bodies);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: section 40D(7) (intermediate copies dealt with by specified bodies);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: section 41A(7) (copies made for purposes of giving or receiving instruction);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: section 41(5) (copies made for purposes of instruction or examination);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: section 44(3) (recordings made by educational establishments for educational purposes);

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: section 45(3) (copies made by educational establishments for purposes of instruction); (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 18)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: section 46(4)(b) (copies made by librarian, curator or archivist in reliance on false declaration); (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 18)

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: section 54A(3) (copies made for purposes of public administration);

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: section 64(2) (further copies, adaptations, etc. of work in electronic form retained on transfer of principal copy);

paragraph.name: m
ma
paragraph.content: section 76A(2) (copies made for private and domestic use); (Added 16 of 2022 s. 18)

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: section 77(4) (copies made for purposes of broadcast or cable programme). (Replaced 15 of 2007 s. 9)

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of subsections (3), (4) and (5), accessory work (附屬作品) means a work incorporated in or consisting of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a label affixed to, or displayed on, an article;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the packaging or container in which an article is packaged or contained;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a label affixed to, or displayed on, the packaging or container in which an article is packaged or contained;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a written instruction, warranty or other information incidental to an article and provided with the article on its sale; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an instructional sound recording or film incidental to an article and provided with the article on its sale,

subsection.continued: and the economic value of the article (inclusive of the label, packaging, container, instruction, warranty, other information, sound recording or film, as the case may be) is not predominantly attributable to the economic value of the work.

section.name: s35A
section.heading: Copy of a computer program, or of certain other works embodied in the same article as a computer program, not an infringing copy for the purposes of section 35(3)

subsection.content: A copy of a work to which this subsection applies is not an infringing copy for the purposes of section 35(3) if it was lawfully made in the country, territory or area where it was made.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of a computer program; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: except as provided in subsection (3) or (4), a copy of a work other than a computer program, which copy is embodied in an article that also embodies a copy of a computer program,

subsection.continued: that, but for subsection (1), would be an infringing copy for the purposes of section 35(3).

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to any copy of a work described in subsection (2)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is a copy of the whole or substantially the whole of a movie or a television drama; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: that is a copy of a part of a movie or a television drama if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: all those parts of the movie or television drama copies of which are embodied in the article together constitute the whole or substantially the whole of the movie or television drama; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the viewing time of all those parts of the movie or television drama copies of which are embodied in the article is, in the case of a movie, more than 15 minutes in aggregate or, in the case of a television drama, more than 10 minutes in aggregate,

subsection.continued: and in paragraphs (a) and (b)(i), reference to a television drama, in the case of a television drama comprising one or more episodes, is reference to an episode of the television drama.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to any copy of a work described in subsection (2)(b) that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of a movie or a television drama (other than a copy to which subsection (3) applies);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of a musical sound recording or a musical visual recording; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a copy that forms part of an e-book,

subsection.continued: (a specified copy of a work) if the article in which the specified copy is embodied is likely, in being acquired by a person for his own use, to be acquired for the purpose of acquiring the specified copies of works that are embodied in it more so than for the purpose of acquiring the copies of works other than specified copies that are embodied in it.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4), in considering the extent to which an article is likely to be acquired for the purpose of acquiring a particular copy of a work that is embodied in it, a copy of those parts of any computer program the function of which is to provide a means of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: viewing or listening to a specified copy of a work that is embodied in the article (or, where that work is in encrypted form, a means of decrypting it so as to enable such viewing or listening); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: searching for any specific part of a specified copy of a work that is embodied in the article,

subsection.continued: shall be regarded as part of the specified copy of a work.

def.name: Ebook
def.leadIn: In this section, e-book (電子書) means a combination of copies of works embodied in a single article and comprising—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: one or more copies of each of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a computer program; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a literary work (other than a computer program), a dramatic work, a musical work or an artistic work (main work),

paragraph.continued: so arranged as to provide for the copy of the main work to be presented in the form of an electronic version of a book, magazine or periodical; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where a main work is accompanied for illustrative purposes by any copy or copies of films or sound recordings, that copy or those copies.

subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, reference in this section, other than subsection (6), to a copy of a work is reference to a copy of the whole or a substantial part of a work.

section.name: s35B
section.heading: Imported copy not an infringing copy for the purposes of section 35(3)

subsection.leadIn: A copy of a work to which this subsection applies is not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the person who imports it into Hong Kong, an infringing copy for the purposes of section 35(3) if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it was lawfully made in the country, territory or area where it was made; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is not imported with a view to its being dealt in by any person for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the person who possesses it, an infringing copy for the purposes of section 35(3) if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it was lawfully made in the country, territory or area where it was made; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is not possessed with a view to its being dealt in by any person for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies to a copy of a work of any description except a copy of a work—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a musical sound recording;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a musical visual recording;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a television drama; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a movie; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is, or is intended to be, played or shown in public.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding the exception in subsection (2), subsection (1) applies to a copy of a work that is referred to in subsection (2)(a) and that is, or is intended to be, played or shown in public—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by an educational establishment for the educational purposes of the establishment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a specified library for use of the library.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (3)(b), a library is regarded as a specified library if it falls within the description of any library specified under section 46(1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: Where a copy of a work is not an infringing copy by virtue of subsection (1) but is subsequently dealt in for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if that dealing takes place within the period of 15 months referred to in section 35(4)(b), it is, for the purposes of sections 118 to 133 (criminal provisions), to be treated, in relation to that dealing and the person who deals in it, as an infringing copy; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: irrespective of the time at which that dealing takes place, it is, for the purposes of any provision of this Ordinance except sections 118 to 133, to be treated, in relation to that dealing and the person who deals in it, as an infringing copy.

subsection.def: In this section, deal in (經銷) means sell, let for hire, offer or expose for sale or hire, or distribute for profit or reward.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Defences for the purposes of sections 30 and 31

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 30 and 31 and for the avoidance of doubt, it is declared that if in an action for infringement of copyright under section 30 or 31 in respect of a copy of a work which is an infringing copy by virtue only of section 35(3) and which was lawfully made in the country, territory or area where it was made, the defendant proves that— (Amended 15 of 2007 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: he had reasonable grounds to be satisfied in the circumstances of the case that the copy was not an infringing copy; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there were no other circumstances which would have led him reasonably to suspect that the copy was an infringing copy,

subsection.continued: he has proved that he did not have reason to believe that the copy was an infringing copy.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether a defendant has proved under subsection (1) that he did not have reason to believe that the copy was an infringing copy of the work, the court may have regard to, including but not limited to, the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether he had made enquiries with a relevant trade body in respect of that category of work;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: whether he had complied with any code of practice that may exist in respect of the supply of that category of work;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether the response, if any, to those enquiries made by the defendant was reasonable and timely;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: whether he was provided with the name, address and contact details of the copyright owner or exclusive licensee (as the case may be);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: whether he was provided with the date of first day of publication of the work;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: whether he was provided with proof of any relevant exclusive licence.

subsection.leadIn: In an action against a person for infringement of copyright under section 30 or 31, it is a defence for that person to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he had placed an order with the copyright owner or the exclusive licensee, as the case may be, for the supply of copies of the work;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person with whom he placed the order had acted unconscionably by either withholding supply on unreasonable grounds or by agreeing to supply on unreasonable terms; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the import took place after that unconscionable act by the copyright owner or exclusive licensee and after the expiration of the period referred to in section 35(4)(b).

subsection.content: In determining whether the copyright owner or exclusive licensee had acted unconscionably, the court shall take into consideration the established practices of the particular trade for the orderly distribution of copies of that category of work and, in particular, whether the order, if fulfilled, would conflict with a normal exploitation of the work by the copyright owner or the exclusive licensee, or would unreasonably prejudice the legitimate interests of the copyright owner or exclusive licensee.

In determining whether supply is withheld on unreasonable grounds or whether the agreement to supply is on unreasonable terms the court shall have regard to the reasonable requirements of the particular trade or particular public, including but not limited to price and delivery times, the practice of the trade with existing stocks in Hong Kong, the practice of the trade generally for the product in its particular medium, category or language, the size of the order, enquiries made and whether or not any person has previously had unfulfilled orders with the particular supplier.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Acts Permitted in Relation to Copyright Works

section.name: s37
section.heading: Introductory provisions

subsection.content: The provisions of this Division specify acts which may be done in relation to copyright works notwithstanding the subsistence of copyright; they relate only to the question of infringement of copyright and do not affect any other right or obligation restricting the doing of any of the specified acts.

Where it is provided by this Division that an act does not infringe copyright, or may be done without infringing copyright, and no particular description of copyright work is mentioned, the act in question does not infringe the copyright in a work of any description.

In determining whether an act specified in this Division may be done in relation to a copyright work notwithstanding the subsistence of copyright, the primary consideration is that the act does not conflict with a normal exploitation of the work by the copyright owner and does not unreasonably prejudice the legitimate interests of the copyright owner.

No inference is to be drawn from the description of any act which may by virtue of this Division be done without infringing copyright as to the scope of the acts restricted by the copyright in any description of work.

The provisions of this Division are to be construed independently of each other, so that the fact that an act does not fall within one provision does not mean that it is not covered by another provision.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Research and private study

subsection.content: Fair dealing with a work for the purposes of research or private study does not infringe any copyright in the work or, in the case of a published edition, in the typographical arrangement. (Amended 15 of 2007 s. 12)

subsection.leadIn: Copying by a person other than the researcher or student himself is not fair dealing if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a librarian, or a person acting on behalf of a librarian, he does anything which regulations under section 49 would not permit to be done under section 47 or 48 (articles or parts of published works: restriction on multiple copies of same material); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, the person doing the copying knows or has reason to believe that it will result in copies of substantially the same material being provided to more than one person at substantially the same time and for substantially the same purpose.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether any dealing with a work is fair dealing under subsection (1), the court shall take into account all the circumstances of the case and, in particular—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the nature of the work;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount and substantiality of the portion dealt with in relation to the work as a whole; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the effect of the dealing on the potential market for or value of the work. (Replaced 15 of 2007 s. 12)

section.name: s39
section.heading: Criticism, review, quotation, and reporting and commenting on current events

subsection.leadIn: Fair dealing with a work (the work) for the purpose of criticism or review of the work or another work, or of a performance of a work, does not infringe any copyright in the work or, for a published edition of the work, in the typographical arrangement of the published edition, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the work has been released or communicated to the public; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (subject to subsection (6)) the dealing is accompanied by a sufficient acknowledgement.

subsection.leadIn: Copyright in a work is not infringed by the use of a quotation from the work (whether for the purpose of criticism, review or otherwise) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the work has been released or communicated to the public;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the use of the quotation is fair dealing with the work;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the extent of the quotation is no more than is required by the specific purpose for which it is used; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: (subject to subsection (6)) the use of the quotation is accompanied by a sufficient acknowledgement.

subsection.content: Fair dealing with a work for the purpose of reporting or commenting on current events does not infringe any copyright in the work or, for a published edition of the work, in the typographical arrangement of the published edition, if (subject to subsection (6)) the dealing is accompanied by a sufficient acknowledgement.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether any dealing with a work is fair dealing under subsection (1), (2)(b) or (3), the court must take into account all the circumstances of the case and, in particular—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the nature of the work;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount and substantiality of the portion dealt with in relation to the work as a whole; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the effect of the dealing on the potential market for, or value of, the work.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (1)(a) and (2)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a work has been released to the public if it has been provided to the public by any means (other than by communication to the public), including—

subparagraph.content: the issue of copies of the work to the public;
the rental of copies of the work to the public; and
the performance, exhibition, playing or showing of the work in public; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in determining whether a work has been released or communicated to the public, no account is to be taken of any unauthorized act.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsections (1)(b), (2)(d) and (3), it is not necessary to accompany the relevant dealing with a sufficient acknowledgement if it is not reasonably practicable to do so.

section.name: s39A
section.heading: Parody, satire, caricature and pastiche

subsection.content: Fair dealing with a work for the purpose of parody, satire, caricature or pastiche does not infringe any copyright in the work.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether any dealing with a work is fair dealing under subsection (1), the court must take into account all the circumstances of the case and, in particular—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the nature of the work;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount and substantiality of the portion dealt with in relation to the work as a whole; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the effect of the dealing on the potential market for, or value of, the work.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Incidental inclusion of copyright material

subsection.content: Copyright in a work is not infringed by its incidental inclusion in an artistic work, sound recording, film, broadcast or cable programme.

The copyright is also not infringed by the issue to the public of copies, or the playing, showing or communicating to the public, of anything whose making was, by virtue of subsection (1), not an infringement of the copyright. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 21)

A musical work, words spoken or sung with music, or so much of a sound recording, broadcast or cable programme as includes a musical work or such words, is not regarded as incidentally included in another work if it is deliberately included.

section.name: s40A
section.heading: Definitions for sections 40A to 40F

subsection.leadIn: In this section and in sections 40B to 40F— (Amended 10 of 2020 s. 4)
subsection.def: accessible copy (便於閱讀格式版), in relation to a copyright work, means a version which provides improved access to the work for a person with a print disability; (Amended 10 of 2020 s. 4)

authorized entity (獲授權實體) means a body—(a)that is in a jurisdiction outside Hong Kong that—(i)is a member of the World Trade Organization; or(ii)is a contracting party to the Marrakesh Treaty to Facilitate Access to Published Works for Persons Who Are Blind, Visually Impaired or Otherwise Print Disabled adopted at Marrakesh in 2013, as revised or amended from time to time; and(b)that—(i)is not established or conducted for profit; and(ii)has a main object or main function that is charitable or otherwise concerned with the advancement of welfare for persons with a print disability; (Added 10 of 2020 s. 4)
copy (文本)—see subsection (2); (Added 10 of 2020 s. 4)
lend (借出), in relation to a copy, means to make it available for use, otherwise than for direct or indirect economic or commercial advantage, on terms that it will be returned;

def.name: PrintDisability
def.leadIn: print disability (閱讀殘障), in relation to a person, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: blindness;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: inability, through physical disability, to hold or manipulate a book; (Amended 10 of 2020 s. 4)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: inability, through physical disability, to focus or move his eyes to the extent that would normally be acceptable for reading; or (Amended 10 of 2020 s. 4)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a perceptual or reading disability (including dyslexia) which cannot be improved to give the person (relevant person) visual function substantially equivalent to that of a person who has no such disability, such that the relevant person is unable to read to substantially the same degree as a person who has no such disability; (Added 10 of 2020 s. 4)

def.name: SpecifiedBody
def.leadIn: specified body (指明團體) means a body of any of the following descriptions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an educational establishment specified in section 1 of Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: an educational establishment receiving direct recurrent subvention from the Government; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: an organization that—

subparagraph.content: is not established or conducted for profit; and
has a main object or main function that is charitable or otherwise concerned with the advancement of welfare for persons with a print disability; (Replaced 10 of 2020 s. 4)

subsection.def: supply (供應), in relation to an accessible copy, includes—(a)communicate the copy; and (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 22)(b)distribute the copy. (Added 10 of 2020 s. 4)

subsection.content: A reference in section 40B, 40C, 40CA or 40CB to a copy of the whole or part of a work includes a copy of the whole or part of the work in audio form, such as an audiobook. (Added 10 of 2020 s. 4)

section.name: s40B
section.heading: Making a single accessible copy for a person with a print disability

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 40CC, if a person with a print disability possesses, or otherwise has lawful access to, a copy of the whole or part of a literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work (master copy), and the master copy is not accessible to the person because of the disability, making an accessible copy of the master copy by or on behalf of the person for the person’s personal use is not an infringement of copyright in the work or—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a published edition of the work—in the typographical arrangement of the published edition; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an audio form of the work—in the sound recording of the work. (Replaced 10 of 2020 s. 5)

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply unless, at the time when the accessible copy is made, the maker of the copy is satisfied, after making reasonable enquiries, that no copy of the relevant copyright work in a form that is accessible to the person with a print disability can be obtained at a reasonable commercial price. (Replaced 10 of 2020 s. 5)

If a person makes an accessible copy on behalf of a person with a print disability under this section and charges for it, the sum charged must not exceed the cost incurred in making and supplying the copy.

subsection.leadIn: Where an accessible copy which apart from this section would be an infringing copy is made or supplied in accordance with this section but is subsequently dealt with, it is to be treated as an infringing copy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of that dealing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that dealing infringes copyright, for all subsequent purposes.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (5), an accessible copy is dealt with if it is—

paragraph.name: a
