paragraph.content: possessed, exhibited in public or distributed, by any person other than the person by whom the copy is made or to whom the copy is supplied under subsection (1), for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sold or let for hire, or offered or exposed for sale or hire. (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 23)

section.name: s40C
section.heading: Making multiple accessible copies by specified bodies for persons with a print disability

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 40CC, if a specified body possesses, or otherwise has lawful access to, a copy of the whole or part of a literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work that has been published or otherwise made publicly available in any media (master copy), and the master copy is not accessible to persons with a print disability, the doing of an act specified in subsection (1A) by the body is not an infringement of copyright in the work or—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a published edition of the work—in the typographical arrangement of the published edition; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an audio form of the work—in the sound recording of the work. (Replaced 10 of 2020 s. 6)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The following acts are specified for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: making accessible copies of the master copy for persons with a print disability for their personal use;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: supplying the accessible copies to those persons for their personal use. (Added 10 of 2020 s. 6)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: If a specified body has made an accessible copy of a master copy under subsection (1), the doing of an act specified in subsection (1C) by the body is also not an infringement of copyright in the work or—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a published edition of the work—in the typographical arrangement of the published edition; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an audio form of the work—in the sound recording of the work. (Added 10 of 2020 s. 6)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: The following acts are specified for the purposes of subsection (1B)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: supplying the accessible copies so made to those persons for their personal use. (Added 10 of 2020 s. 6)

subsection.content: Subsections (1) and (1A) do not apply unless, at the time when the accessible copies are made, the specified body is satisfied, after making reasonable enquiries, that no copy of the relevant copyright work in a form that is accessible to a person with a print disability can be obtained at a reasonable commercial price. (Replaced 10 of 2020 s. 6)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: Subsections (1B) and (1C) do not apply unless, at the time when the further accessible copies are made, the specified body is satisfied, after making reasonable enquiries, that no copy of the relevant copyright work in a form that is accessible to a person with a print disability can be obtained at a reasonable commercial price. (Added 10 of 2020 s. 6)

subsection.leadIn: The specified body must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within a reasonable time before making or supplying the accessible copies, notify the relevant copyright owner of its intention to make or supply the accessible copies; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within a reasonable time after making or supplying the accessible copies, notify the relevant copyright owner of the fact that it has made or supplied the accessible copies.

subsection.content: Subsection (4) does not apply if the specified body cannot, after making reasonable enquiries, ascertain the identity and contact details of the relevant copyright owner. (Amended 10 of 2020 s. 6)
If the specified body charges for making and supplying an accessible copy under this section, the sum charged must not exceed the cost incurred in making and supplying the copy.

subsection.leadIn: Where an accessible copy which apart from this section would be an infringing copy is made or supplied in accordance with this section but is subsequently dealt with, it is to be treated as an infringing copy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of that dealing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that dealing infringes copyright, for all subsequent purposes.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (7), an accessible copy is dealt with if it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: possessed, exhibited in public or distributed, by any person other than the specified body by which the copy is made or the person to whom the copy is supplied under subsection (1A) or (1C) (as the case may be), for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sold or let for hire, or offered or exposed for sale or hire. (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 24)

section.name: s40CA
section.heading: Export or supply of accessible copies by specified bodies to authorized entities

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 40CC, if a specified body possesses, or otherwise has lawful access to, a copy of the whole or part of a literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work that has been published or otherwise made publicly available in any media (master copy), and the master copy is not accessible to persons with a print disability, the doing of an act specified in subsection (2) by the body is not an infringement of copyright in the work or—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a published edition of the work—in the typographical arrangement of the published edition; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an audio form of the work—in the sound recording of the work.

subsection.leadIn: The following acts are specified for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: making an accessible copy of the master copy for the purpose of export or supply to an authorized entity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exporting or supplying the accessible copy to the entity.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply unless both of the following conditions are met by the specified body before exporting or supplying an accessible copy to an authorized entity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the body has obtained the entity’s confirmation that no copy of the relevant copyright work in a form that is accessible to persons with a print disability can be obtained at a reasonable commercial price in the jurisdiction the entity is in;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the body does not know, and does not have reasonable grounds for believing, that the accessible copy would be used otherwise than by persons with a print disability for their personal use.

subsection.leadIn: If a specified body has made an accessible copy of a master copy under section 40C, the doing of an act specified in subsection (5) by the body is also not an infringement of copyright in the work or—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a published edition of the work—in the typographical arrangement of the published edition; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an audio form of the work—in the sound recording of the work.

subsection.leadIn: The following acts are specified for the purposes of subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: making another accessible copy from the accessible copy concerned for the purpose of export or supply to an authorized entity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exporting or supplying that other accessible copy to the entity.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (4) and (5) do not apply unless both of the following conditions are met by the specified body before exporting or supplying an accessible copy to an authorized entity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the body has obtained the entity’s confirmation that no copy of the relevant copyright work in a form that is accessible to persons with a print disability can be obtained at a reasonable commercial price in the jurisdiction the entity is in;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the body does not know, and does not have reasonable grounds for believing, that the accessible copy would be used otherwise than by persons with a print disability for their personal use.

subsection.content: In determining whether a specified body does not know, or does not have reasonable grounds for believing, that an accessible copy would be used otherwise than by persons with a print disability for their personal use, the court may have regard to all the circumstances including whether the body has obtained a confirmation from the authorized entity that the copy would only be provided to persons with a print disability for their personal use.

subsection.leadIn: The specified body must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within a reasonable time before making, exporting or supplying the accessible copy, notify the relevant copyright owner of its intention to make, export or supply the copy; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within a reasonable time after making, exporting or supplying the accessible copy, notify the relevant copyright owner that it has made, exported or supplied the copy.

subsection.content: Subsection (8) does not apply if the specified body cannot, after making reasonable enquiries, ascertain the identity and contact details of the relevant copyright owner.
If the specified body charges for making, exporting or supplying an accessible copy under this section, the sum charged must not exceed the cost incurred in making, exporting or supplying the copy.

subsection.leadIn: Where an accessible copy which apart from this section would be an infringing copy is made, exported or supplied in accordance with this section but is subsequently dealt with, it is to be treated as an infringing copy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of that dealing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that dealing infringes copyright, for all subsequent purposes.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (11), an accessible copy is dealt with if it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: possessed, exhibited in public or distributed, by any person other than the specified body by which the copy is made or the authorized entity to which the copy is exported or supplied under subsection (2) or (5) (as the case may be), for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sold or let for hire, or offered or exposed for sale or hire. (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 25)

section.name: s40CB
section.heading: Import or obtainment of accessible copies by specified bodies from authorized entities

subsection.leadIn: The doing of an act specified in subsection (2) by a specified body for the purpose of supplying accessible copies of the whole or part of a literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work to persons with a print disability for their personal use is not an infringement of copyright in the work or—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a published edition of the work—in the typographical arrangement of the published edition; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an audio form of the work—in the sound recording of the work.

subsection.leadIn: The following acts are specified for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: importing or obtaining an accessible copy of the work from an authorized entity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: possessing the accessible copy so imported or obtained;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: making further accessible copies from the accessible copy so imported or obtained;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: supplying the accessible copies so imported, obtained or made.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the accessible copy records, or the making of the accessible copy would involve recording, a performance of the whole or part of a dramatic work.

subsection.content: Also, subsections (1) and (2) do not apply unless, at the relevant time, the specified body is satisfied, after making reasonable enquiries, that no copy of the relevant copyright work in a form that is accessible to persons with a print disability can be obtained at a reasonable commercial price.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (4)—
subsection.def: relevant time (有關時間) means—(a)in relation to importing or obtaining an accessible copy of a work from an authorized entity—the time when the copy is imported or obtained; and(b)in relation to making a further accessible copy from an accessible copy of a work—the time when the further accessible copy is made.

subsection.content: If the specified body charges for importing, obtaining, making or supplying an accessible copy under this section, the sum charged must not exceed the cost incurred in importing, obtaining, making or supplying the copy.

subsection.leadIn: Where an accessible copy which apart from this section would be an infringing copy is imported, obtained, possessed, made or supplied in accordance with this section but is subsequently dealt with, it is to be treated as an infringing copy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of that dealing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that dealing infringes copyright, for all subsequent purposes.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (7), an accessible copy is dealt with if it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: possessed, exhibited in public or distributed, by any person other than the specified body by which the copy is imported, obtained, possessed or made under subsection (2) or the person to whom the copy is supplied under subsection (1), for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sold or let for hire, or offered or exposed for sale or hire. (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 26)

section.name: s40CC
section.heading: Provisions relating to master copy

subsection.leadIn: Sections 40B(1), 40C(1) and 40CA(1) do not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the relevant master copy is an infringing copy;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the relevant master copy is a copy of a sound recording that comprises only of the performance of—

subparagraph.content: the whole or part of a musical work;
music in which words are spoken, or are sung, incidentally to or in association with the music;
the whole or part of a dramatic work; or
any combination of the items described in subparagraphs (i), (ii) and (iii);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the relevant master copy is of the whole or part of a musical work, and the making of an accessible copy would involve recording a performance of the whole or part of the work; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the relevant master copy is of the whole or part of a dramatic work, and the making of an accessible copy would involve recording a performance of the whole or part of the work.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant master copy (有關原版文本), in relation to section 40B(1), 40C(1) or 40CA(1), means a master copy as defined by that section.

section.name: s40D
section.heading: Intermediate copies

subsection.leadIn: A specified body entitled to make accessible copies of a master copy under section 40C may possess an intermediate copy of the master copy which is necessarily created during the production of the accessible copies, but—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the specified body may possess the intermediate copy only for the purpose of the production of further accessible copies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the specified body must destroy the intermediate copy within 3 months after it is no longer required for that purpose.

subsection.content: An intermediate copy possessed otherwise than in accordance with subsection (1) is to be treated as an infringing copy.

A specified body may lend or transfer an intermediate copy possessed under subsection (1) to another specified body which is also entitled to make accessible copies of the relevant copyright work under section 40C.

subsection.leadIn: The specified body must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within a reasonable time before lending or transferring the intermediate copy, notify the relevant copyright owner of its intention to lend or transfer the intermediate copy; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within a reasonable time after lending or transferring the intermediate copy, notify the relevant copyright owner of the fact that it has lent or transferred the intermediate copy.

subsection.content: Subsection (4) does not apply if the specified body cannot, after making reasonable enquiries, ascertain the identity and contact details of the relevant copyright owner. (Amended 10 of 2020 s. 8)
If the specified body charges for lending or transferring an intermediate copy under this section, the sum charged must not exceed the cost incurred in lending or transferring the copy.

subsection.leadIn: Where an intermediate copy which apart from this section would be an infringing copy is possessed, lent or transferred in accordance with this section but is subsequently dealt with, it is to be treated as an infringing copy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of that dealing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that dealing infringes copyright, for all subsequent purposes.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (7), an intermediate copy is dealt with if it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: exhibited in public or distributed, by any person other than the specified body entitled to possess the copy under subsection (1) or the specified body to which the copy is lent or transferred under subsection (3), for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sold or let for hire, or offered or exposed for sale or hire. (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 27)

section.name: s40E
section.heading: Records to be kept by specified bodies

subsection.content: A specified body must make a record of any accessible copy made or supplied under section 40C as soon as practicable after it is made or supplied.

subsection.leadIn: The record referred to in subsection (1) must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the accessible copy is made or supplied;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the form of the accessible copy;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the title, publisher and edition of the relevant master copy or, if the title, publisher or edition is not known, a description of the relevant master copy;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the accessible copy is made for or supplied to a body or a class of persons—the name of the body or a description of the class of persons; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if more than one copy of the accessible copy is made or supplied—the total number of such copies.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: A specified body must make a record of any accessible copy exported or supplied under section 40CA as soon as practicable after it is exported or supplied. (Added 10 of 2020 s. 9)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: The record referred to in subsection (2A) must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the specified body sent the accessible copy to the authorized entity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the form of the accessible copy;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the title, publisher and edition of the relevant master copy or, if the title, publisher or edition is not known, a description of the relevant master copy; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the name of the authorized entity to which the accessible copy is exported or supplied. (Added 10 of 2020 s. 9)

subsection.name: 2C
subsection.content: A specified body must make a record of any accessible copy imported or obtained under section 40CB as soon as practicable after it is imported or obtained. (Added 10 of 2020 s. 9)

subsection.name: 2D
subsection.leadIn: The record referred to in subsection (2C) must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the accessible copy is received by the specified body;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the form of the accessible copy;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the name of the authorized entity from which the accessible copy is imported or obtained;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the name or description of the person or persons to whom the accessible copy is supplied under section 40CB; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: if more than one copy of the accessible copy is so supplied—the total number of such copies. (Added 10 of 2020 s. 9)

subsection.content: A specified body must make a record of any intermediate copy lent or transferred under section 40D as soon as practicable after it is lent or transferred.

subsection.leadIn: The record referred to in subsection (3) must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the specified body to which and the date on which the intermediate copy is lent or transferred;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the form of the intermediate copy; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the title, publisher and edition of the relevant master copy or, if the title, publisher or edition is not known, a description of the relevant master copy.

subsection.leadIn: A specified body must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: retain any record made under subsection (1), (2A), (2C) or (3) for a period of at least 3 years after it is made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow the relevant copyright owner or a person acting for him, on giving reasonable notice, to inspect and make copies of the record at any reasonable time.

section.name: s40F
section.heading: Supplementary provisions for sections 40A to 40E

subsection.content: This section supplements sections 40A to 40E.

A copy (other than an accessible copy made under section 40B, 40C, 40CA or 40CB) of a copyright work is taken to be accessible to a person with a print disability only if it is as accessible to the person as it would be if the person were not suffering from the disability. (Amended 10 of 2020 s. 10)

subsection.leadIn: An accessible copy of a copyright work may be in the form of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a sound recording of the work;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Braille, large-print or electronic version of the work; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other specialized format of the work.

subsection.leadIn: An accessible copy of a copyright work may include facilities for navigating around the version of the work but must not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: changes which are not necessary to overcome problems caused by a print disability; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: changes which infringe the moral right of the author of the work conferred by section 92 not to have the work subjected to derogatory treatment.

section.name: s41A
section.heading: Fair dealing for purposes of giving or receiving instruction

subsection.content: Fair dealing with a work by or on behalf of a teacher or by a pupil for the purposes of giving or receiving instruction in a specified course of study provided by an educational establishment does not infringe the copyright in the work or, in the case of a published edition, in the typographical arrangement.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether any dealing with a work is fair dealing under subsection (1), the court shall take into account all the circumstances of the case and, in particular—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the nature of the work;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount and substantiality of the portion dealt with in relation to the work as a whole; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the effect of the dealing on the potential market for or value of the work.

subsection.leadIn: Where any dealing with a work involves the inclusion of any passage or excerpt from a published literary or dramatic work in an anthology—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the inclusion is not accompanied by a sufficient acknowledgement, the dealing is not fair dealing under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the inclusion is accompanied by a sufficient acknowledgement, subsection (2) applies in determining whether the dealing is fair dealing under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: Where any dealing with a work involves the making of a recording of a broadcast or cable programme or a copy of such a recording—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if an acknowledgement of authorship or other creative effort contained in the work recorded is not incorporated in the recording, the dealing is not fair dealing under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an acknowledgement of authorship or other creative effort contained in the work recorded is incorporated in the recording, subsection (2) applies in determining whether the dealing is fair dealing under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: Where any dealing with a work involves the communication of the work through a wire or wireless network wholly or partly controlled by an educational establishment— (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 28)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the educational establishment fails to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: adopt technological measures to restrict access to the work through the network so that the work is communicated only to persons who need to use the work for the purposes of giving or receiving instruction in the specified course of study in question or for the purposes of maintaining or managing the network; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: ensure that the work is not stored in the network for a period longer than is necessary for the purposes of giving or receiving instruction in the specified course of study in question or, in any event, for a period longer than 12 consecutive months,

paragraph.continued: the dealing is not fair dealing under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the educational establishment—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: adopts technological measures to restrict access to the work through the network so that the work is communicated only to persons who need to use the work for the purposes of giving or receiving instruction in the specified course of study in question or for the purposes of maintaining or managing the network; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: ensures that the work is not stored in the network for a period longer than is necessary for the purposes of giving or receiving instruction in the specified course of study in question or, in any event, for a period longer than 12 consecutive months,

paragraph.continued: subsection (2) applies in determining whether the dealing is fair dealing under subsection (1). (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 28)

subsection.content: Without affecting the generality of section 37(5), where any dealing with a work involves the making of copies, the fact that the making of the copies does not fall within section 45 does not mean that it is not covered by this section, and subsection (2) applies in determining whether the dealing is fair dealing under subsection (1). (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: Where a copy which apart from this section would be an infringing copy is made in accordance with this section but is subsequently dealt with, it is to be treated as an infringing copy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of that dealing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that dealing infringes copyright, for all subsequent purposes.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (7), a copy is dealt with if it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: possessed, exhibited in public or distributed (otherwise than for the purposes mentioned in subsection (1)) for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sold or let for hire, or offered or exposed for sale or hire. (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 28)

section.name: s41
section.heading: Things done for purposes of instruction or examination

subsection.leadIn: Copyright in a literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work is not infringed by its being copied, to a reasonable extent, in the course of instruction or of preparation for instruction, if the copying—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is done by a person giving or receiving instruction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not by means of a reprographic process.

subsection.content: Copyright in a sound recording, film, broadcast or cable programme is not infringed by its being copied by making a film or film sound-track in the course of instruction, or of preparation for instruction, in the making of films or film sound-tracks, if the copying is done by a person giving or receiving instruction.
Copyright is not infringed by anything done for the purposes of an examination by way of setting the questions, communicating the questions to the candidates or answering the questions.
Subsection (3) does not extend to the making of a reprographic copy of a musical work for use by an examination candidate in performing the work.

Where a copy which would otherwise be an infringing copy is made in accordance with this section but is subsequently dealt with, the copy is treated as an infringing copy for the purpose of that dealing and if that dealing infringes copyright, for all subsequent purposes. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 29)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (5), a copy is dealt with if it is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: sold or let for hire, or offered or exposed for sale or hire; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: communicated to the public, unless that communication is not an infringement of copyright under subsection (3). (Added 16 of 2022 s. 29)

section.name: s42
section.heading: Anthologies for educational use

subsection.leadIn: The inclusion of a short passage from a published literary or dramatic work in a collection which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is intended for use in educational establishments and is so described in its title, and in any advertisements issued by or on behalf of the publisher; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: consists mainly of material in which no copyright subsists,

subsection.continued: does not infringe the copyright in the work if the work itself is not intended for use in such establishments and the inclusion is accompanied by a sufficient acknowledgement.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not authorize the inclusion of more than 2 excerpts from copyright works by the same author in collections published by the same publisher over any period of 5 years.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to any given passage the reference in subsection (2) to excerpts from works by the same author—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is taken to include excerpts from works by him in collaboration with another; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the passage in question is from such a work, is taken to include excerpts from works by any of the authors, whether alone or in collaboration with another.

subsection.content: References in this section to the use of a work in an educational establishment are to any use for the educational purposes of such an establishment.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Performing, playing or showing work in course of activities of educational establishments

subsection.leadIn: The performance of a literary, dramatic or musical work before an audience consisting wholly or mainly of teachers and pupils at an educational establishment, parents or guardians of pupils at the establishment, and other persons directly connected with the activities of the establishment— (Amended 15 of 2007 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a teacher or pupil in the course of the activities of the establishment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the establishment by any person for the purposes of instruction,

subsection.continued: is not a public performance for the purposes of infringement of copyright.

subsection.content: The playing or showing of a sound recording, film, broadcast or cable programme before such audience at an educational establishment for the purposes of giving or receiving instruction is not a playing or showing of the work in public for the purposes of infringement of copyright. (Amended 15 of 2007 s. 15)

section.name: s44
section.heading: Recording, copying or communication by educational establishments: broadcasts or cable programmes

subsection.leadIn: A recording of a broadcast or cable programme, or a copy of such a recording may be made by or on behalf of an educational establishment for the educational purposes of that establishment without thereby infringing the copyright in the broadcast or cable programme, or in any work included in it, if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: it is not made for gain.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: A person authorized by an educational establishment may, without infringing copyright, communicate to an authorized recipient a recording, or a copy of a recording, of a broadcast or cable programme that has been made in accordance with subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person makes the communication for the educational purposes of the establishment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the establishment takes all reasonable steps to ensure that—

subparagraph.content: only authorized recipients receive the communication; and
the authorized recipients do not make any copy or further transmission of the communication. (Added 16 of 2022 s. 30)

subsection.content: Recording, copying or communicating to authorized recipients is not authorized by this section if, or to the extent that, licences under licensing schemes are available authorizing the recording, copying or communication in question and the person making the recording, copies or communication in question knew or ought to have been aware of that fact. (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 30)

Where a recording or copy which would otherwise be an infringing copy is made in accordance with this section but is subsequently dealt with, the copy is treated as an infringing copy for the purposes of that dealing and if that dealing infringes copyright, for all subsequent purposes. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 30)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3), a recording or copy is dealt with if it is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: sold or let for hire, or offered or exposed for sale or hire; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: communicated to the public, unless that communication is not an infringement of copyright under subsection (1A). (Added 16 of 2022 s. 30)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized recipient (獲授權收訊人), in relation to a communication made by a person authorized by an educational establishment, means a teacher or pupil of the establishment who has been authorized by or on behalf of the establishment to receive the communication. (Added 16 of 2022 s. 30)

section.name: s45
section.heading: Copying or communication by educational establishments or pupils: passages or extracts from published works

subsection.content: Copies of artistic works or of passages from published literary, dramatic or musical works, or extracts from published sound recordings or films, may, to a reasonable extent, be made by or on behalf of an educational establishment for the purposes of giving instruction, or by a pupil for the purposes of receiving instruction in a specified course of study provided by an educational establishment, without infringing any copyright in the work, in the typographical arrangement, or in the sound recording or film (as the case may be). (Amended 15 of 2007 s. 16; 16 of 2022 s. 31)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: A person authorized by an educational establishment may, without infringing copyright, communicate to an authorized recipient a copy of an artistic work, a passage from a published literary, dramatic or musical work, or an extract from a published sound recording or film, that has been made in accordance with subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person makes the communication for the educational purposes of the establishment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the establishment takes all reasonable steps to ensure that—

subparagraph.content: only authorized recipients receive the communication; and
the authorized recipients do not make any copy or further transmission of the communication. (Added 16 of 2022 s. 31)

subsection.content: Copying or communicating to authorized recipients is not authorized by this section if, or to the extent that, licences under licensing schemes are available authorizing the copying or communication in question and the person making the copies or communication in question knew or ought to have been aware of that fact. (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 31)

Where a copy which would otherwise be an infringing copy is made in accordance with this section but is subsequently dealt with, it is treated as an infringing copy for the purposes of that dealing, and if that dealing infringes copyright, for all subsequent purposes. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 31)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3), a copy is dealt with if it is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: sold or let for hire, or offered or exposed for sale or hire; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: communicated to the public, unless that communication is not an infringement of copyright under subsection (1A). (Added 16 of 2022 s. 31)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized recipient (獲授權收訊人), in relation to a communication made by a person authorized by an educational establishment, means a teacher or pupil of the establishment who has been authorized by or on behalf of the establishment to receive the communication. (Added 16 of 2022 s. 31)

section.name: s46
section.heading: Libraries, museums and archives: introductory

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development may— (Amended L.N. 173 of 2000; L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by regulations prescribe conditions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice in the Gazette specify libraries, museums or archives,

subsection.continued: for the purposes of any provision in sections 47 to 53 (copying and communication by librarians, curators and archivists).

subsection.leadIn: In sections 47 to 53—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: references in any provision to the prescribed conditions are to the conditions prescribed for the purposes of that provision under subsection (1)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: references in any provision to a specified library, museum or archive are to a library, museum or archive of a description specified for the purposes of that provision under subsection (1)(b).

subsection.leadIn: The regulations may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: provide that, where a librarian, curator or archivist is required to be satisfied as to any matter before making or supplying a copy of a work— (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 33)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: he may rely on a signed declaration as to that matter by the person requesting the copy, unless he is aware that it is false in a material particular; and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make different provisions for different descriptions of libraries, museums or archives and for different purposes.

subsection.leadIn: Where a person requesting a copy makes a declaration which is false in a material particular and is supplied with a copy which would have been an infringing copy if made by him—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he is liable for infringement of copyright as if he had made the copy himself; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the copy is treated as an infringing copy.

subsection.content: References in this section, and in sections 47 to 53, to the librarian, curator or archivist include a person acting on his behalf.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Copying by librarians: articles in periodicals

subsection.content: The librarian of a specified library may, if the prescribed conditions are complied with, make and supply a copy of an article in a periodical without infringing any copyright in the text, in any illustrations accompanying the text or in the typographical arrangement.

subsection.leadIn: The prescribed conditions must include the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that copies are supplied only to persons satisfying the librarian that they require them for purposes of research or private study, and will not use them for any other purpose;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that no person is furnished with more than one copy of the same article or with copies of more than one article contained in the same issue of a periodical; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that persons to whom copies are supplied are required to pay for them a sum not less than the cost (including a contribution to the general expenses of the library) attributable to their production.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Copying by librarians: parts of published works

subsection.content: The librarian of a specified library may, if the prescribed conditions are complied with, make and supply a copy of part of a published literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work (other than an article in a periodical), or of part of a published sound recording or film, without infringing any copyright in the work, in any illustrations accompanying the work, in the typographical arrangement, or in the sound recording or film (as the case may be). (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 35)

subsection.leadIn: The prescribed conditions must include the following—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that no person is furnished with more than one copy of the same material or with a copy of more than a reasonable proportion of any work; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that persons to whom copies are supplied are required to pay for them a sum not less than the cost (including a contribution to the general expenses of the library) attributable to their production.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Restriction on production of multiple copies of the same material

subsection.content: Regulations for the purposes of sections 47 and 48 (copying by librarian of article or part of published work) must contain provision to the effect that a copy is supplied only to a person satisfying the librarian that his requirement is not related to any similar requirement of another person.

subsection.leadIn: The regulations may provide—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that requirements are regarded as similar if the requirements are for copies of substantially the same material at substantially the same time and for substantially the same purpose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that requirements of persons are regarded as related if those persons receive instruction to which the material is relevant at the same time and place.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Copying by librarians: supply of copies to other libraries

subsection.leadIn: The librarian of a specified library may, if the prescribed conditions are complied with, make and supply to another specified library a copy of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an article in a periodical;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the whole or part of a published literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work; or (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 36)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a sound recording or film,

subsection.continued: without infringing any copyright in the text of the article, in the work, in any illustration accompanying it, in the typographical arrangement, or in the sound recording or film, as the case may be.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(b) and (c) does not apply if at the time the copy is made the librarian making it knows, or could by reasonable inquiry ascertain, the name and address of a person entitled to authorize the making of the copy.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Copying by librarians, curators or archivists: preservation or replacement copies of works

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (1A), the librarian, curator or archivist of a specified library, museum or archive may, if the prescribed conditions are complied with, make a copy from any item in the permanent collection of the library, museum or archive— (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 37)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in order to preserve or replace that item by placing the copy in its permanent collection in addition to or in place of it; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in order to replace in the permanent collection of another specified library, museum or archive an item which has been lost, destroyed or damaged, (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 37)

subsection.continued: without infringing the copyright in any literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work, in any illustrations accompanying such a work or, in the case of a published edition, in the typographical arrangement or, in the case of a sound recording or a film, in the sound recording or film. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 37)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The total number of copies made from an item in the permanent collection of a specified library, museum or archive and placed in the permanent collection of that library, museum or archive must not exceed 3 at any one time, and only one of those copies may be accessible to the public at that library, museum or archive. (Added 16 of 2022 s. 37)

The prescribed conditions must include provision for restricting the making of copies to cases where it is not reasonably practicable to purchase a copy of the item in question to fulfill that purpose.

section.name: s51A
section.heading: Communication by librarians, curators or archivists: copies of works

subsection.content: If the conditions specified in subsection (2) are complied with, the librarian, curator or archivist of a specified library, museum or archive may, without infringing copyright, communicate a copy of an item in the permanent collection of the library, museum or archive made under section 51 to the users or staff of the library, museum or archive, by making it available online to be accessed through the use of a computer terminal installed within the premises of the library, museum or archive.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that only 1 user may access the copy at any one time; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the library, museum or archive takes appropriate measures to prevent users from making further copies or communicating the copy to others.

subsection.content: Communicating to users or staff of a specified library, museum or archive is not authorized by this section if, or to the extent that, licences under licensing schemes are available authorizing the communication in question and the person making the communication in question knew or ought to have been aware of that fact.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Copying by librarians, curators or archivists: certain unpublished works

subsection.leadIn: The librarian, curator or archivist of a specified library, museum or archive may, if the prescribed conditions are complied with, make and supply a copy of the whole or part of— (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 39)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work from a document (including a document in electronic form); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a sound recording or film,

subsection.continued: in the library, museum or archive without infringing any copyright in the work or any illustrations accompanying it or in the sound recording or film.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the work had been published before it was deposited in the library, museum or archive; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the copyright owner has prohibited copying of the work,

subsection.continued: and at the time the copy is made the librarian, curator or archivist making it is, or ought to be, aware of that fact.

subsection.leadIn: The prescribed conditions must include the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that copies are supplied only to persons satisfying the librarian, curator or archivist that they require them for purposes of research or private study and will not use them for any other purpose;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that no person is furnished with more than one copy of the same material; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that persons to whom copies are supplied are required to pay for them a sum not less than the cost (including a contribution to the general expenses of the library, museum or archive) attributable to their production.

section.name: s52A
section.heading: Playing or showing by librarians, curators or archivists: sound recordings or films

subsection.content: If the condition specified in subsection (2) is complied with, the librarian, curator or archivist of a specified library, museum or archive may play or show any sound recording or film held in the permanent collection of the library, museum or archive to an audience consisting of members of the public within the premises of the library, museum or archive, without infringing the copyright in the sound recording or film or any work included in the sound recording or film.

The condition is that if the audience is required to pay for the playing or showing of the sound recording or film, the payment required is no more than a reasonable contribution towards the maintenance of the library, museum or archive.

The playing or showing of a sound recording or film is not authorized by this section if, or to the extent that, licences under licensing schemes are available authorizing the playing or showing in question and the person playing or showing the sound recording or film in question knew or ought to have been aware of that fact.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Copying by librarians, curators or archivists: articles of cultural or historical importance
section.content: The librarian, curator or archivist of a specified library, museum or archive may make a copy of an article of cultural or historical importance or interest and deposit the copy at the library, museum or archive without infringing any copyright in respect of the article if the article is likely to be lost to Hong Kong through sale or export.

section.name: s54A
section.heading: Fair dealing for purposes of public administration

subsection.content: Fair dealing with a work by the Government, the Executive Council, the Judiciary or any District Council for the purposes of efficient administration of urgent business does not infringe the copyright in the work or, in the case of a published edition, in the typographical arrangement.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether any dealing with a work is fair dealing under subsection (1), the court shall take into account all the circumstances of the case and, in particular—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the nature of the work;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount and substantiality of the portion dealt with in relation to the work as a whole; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the effect of the dealing on the potential market for or value of the work.

subsection.leadIn: Where a copy which apart from this section would be an infringing copy is made in accordance with this section but is subsequently dealt with, it is to be treated as an infringing copy—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of that dealing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.text: if that dealing infringes copyright, for all subsequent purposes.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3), a copy is dealt with if it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: possessed, exhibited in public or distributed (otherwise than for the purposes mentioned in subsection (1)) for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sold or let for hire, or offered or exposed for sale or hire. (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 42)

section.name: s54B
section.heading: Legislative Council

subsection.leadIn: Copyright is not infringed by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: anything done for the purposes of the proceedings of the Legislative Council; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: anything done by or on behalf of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the members of the Legislative Council; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: The Legislative Council Commission,

paragraph.continued: for the purposes of the exercise and discharge by the Legislative Council of its powers and functions.

subsection.content: Copyright is not infringed by anything done for the purposes of reporting the proceedings of the Legislative Council; but this is not to be construed as authorizing the copying of a work which is itself a published report of the proceedings.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Judicial proceedings

subsection.content: Copyright is not infringed by anything done for the purposes of judicial proceedings. (Amended 15 of 2007 s. 18)

Copyright is not infringed by anything done for the purposes of reporting such proceedings; but this is not to be construed as authorizing the copying of a work which is itself a published report of the proceedings.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Statutory inquiries

subsection.content: Copyright is not infringed by anything done for the purposes of the proceedings of a statutory inquiry.

Copyright is not infringed by anything done for the purposes of reporting any such proceedings held in public; but this is not to be construed as authorizing the copying of a work which is itself a published report of the proceedings.

Copyright in a work is not infringed by communicating to the public the report of a statutory inquiry containing the work or material from it or by issuing copies of the report to the public. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 43)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: StatutoryInquiry
def.leadIn: statutory inquiry (法定研訊) means an inquiry held or investigation conducted in pursuance of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissions of Inquiry Ordinance (Cap. 86); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a duty imposed or power conferred by or under an Ordinance.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Material open to public inspection or on official register

subsection.content: Where material is open to public inspection pursuant to a statutory requirement, or is on a statutory register, copyright is not infringed by the copying of so much of the material as contains factual information of any description, by or with the authority of the appropriate person, for a purpose which does not involve communicating the material to the public or issuing copies of the material to the public. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 44)

Where material is open to public inspection pursuant to a statutory requirement, copyright is not infringed by copying the material, communicating the material to the public or issuing copies of the material to the public, by or with the authority of the appropriate person, for the purpose of enabling the material to be inspected at a more convenient time or place or otherwise facilitating the exercise of any right for the purpose of which the requirement is imposed. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 44)

Where material which is open to public inspection pursuant to a statutory requirement, or which is on a statutory register, contains information about matters of general scientific, technical, commercial or economic interest, copyright is not infringed by copying the material, communicating the material to the public or issuing copies of the material to the public, by or with the authority of the appropriate person, for the purpose of disseminating that information. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 44)

The Chief Executive may by regulation provide that subsection (1), (2) or (3) applies, in such cases as may be specified in the regulation, only to copies marked in such manner as may be so specified. (Amended 22 of 1999 s. 3)

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive may by regulation provide that subsections (1) to (3) apply, to such extent and with such modifications as may be specified in the regulation— (Amended 22 of 1999 s. 3)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to material made open to public inspection by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an international organization specified in the regulation; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person so specified who has functions in Hong Kong under an international agreement to which Hong Kong is a party; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to a register maintained by an international organization specified in the regulation,

subsection.continued: as they apply in relation to material open to public inspection pursuant to a statutory requirement or to a statutory register.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: appropriate person (適當的人) means the person required to make the material open to public inspection or, as the case may be, the person maintaining the statutory register;
statutory register (法定登記冊) means a register maintained in pursuance of a requirement imposed by or under an Ordinance;
statutory requirement (法例規定) means a requirement imposed by or under an Ordinance.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Material provided to the Government in the course of public business

subsection.content: This section applies where a work has in the course of public business been provided to the Government for any purpose, by or with the licence of the copyright owner and a document or other material thing recording or embodying the work is owned by or in the custody or control of the Government.

The Government may, for the purpose for which the work was provided to it, or any related purpose which could reasonably have been anticipated by the copyright owner, copy the work, communicate the work to the public or issue copies of the work to the public without infringing any copyright in the work.

The Government may not copy a work, communicate a work to the public or issue copies of a work to the public by virtue of this section if the work has previously been published otherwise than by virtue of this section.

subsection.def: In subsection (1) public business (公務) includes any activity carried on by the Government.

subsection.content: This section has effect subject to any agreement to the contrary between the Government and the copyright owner.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Public records

subsection.content: Material which is comprised in public records which are open to public inspection may be copied, and a copy may be supplied to any person without infringement of copyright.

subsection.def: In this section public records (公共紀錄) means the records of any nature or description which have been made, received or acquired in the course of proceedings of the Legislative Council, judicial proceedings or executive transaction, together with the exhibits and other material evidence which form part of or are annexed to or are otherwise related to any record, which are or are required to be in the custody of, or which may be transferred to or be acquired by, any department of the Government.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Acts done under statutory authority

subsection.content: Where the doing of a particular act is specifically authorized by an Ordinance, whenever enacted, then, unless the Ordinance provides otherwise, the doing of that act does not infringe copyright.
Nothing in this section is to be construed as excluding any defence of statutory authority otherwise available under or by virtue of any Ordinance.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Lawful user may make back-up copy of computer program

subsection.content: A lawful user of a copy of a computer program may make a back-up copy of the program without infringing the copyright in the program if it is necessary for him to have the back-up copy for the purposes of his lawful use.
For the purposes of this section and section 61 a person is a lawful user of a computer program if he has a contractual right to use the program.
This section has effect subject to any agreement to the contrary.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Lawful user may copy or adapt computer program

subsection.content: A lawful user of a copy of a computer program may copy or adapt the program without infringing the copyright in the program if the copying or adapting is necessary for his lawful use.
A lawful user of a copy of a computer program may, in particular, if it is necessary for the lawful use of the program, copy the program or adapt it for the purpose of correcting errors in it.
This section does not apply to any copying or adapting permitted under section 60.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Use of typeface in ordinary course of printing

subsection.leadIn: It is not an infringement of copyright in an artistic work consisting of the design of a typeface—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to use the typeface in the ordinary course of typing, composing text, typesetting or printing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to possess an article for the purpose of such use; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to do anything in relation to material produced by such use,

subsection.continued: and this is so notwithstanding that an article is used which is an infringing copy of the work.

subsection.content: However, the following provisions of this Part apply in relation to persons making, importing, exporting or dealing with articles specifically designed or adapted for producing material in a particular typeface, or possessing such articles for the purpose of dealing with them, as if the production of material as mentioned in subsection (1) did infringe copyright in the artistic work consisting of the design of the typeface—
section 109 (order for delivery up); and
section 118(4) (offence of making or possessing such an article).

subsection.def: The references in subsection (2) to dealing with (進行物品的交易) an article are to selling, letting for hire, or offering or exposing for sale or hire, exhibiting in public, or distributing. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019)

section.name: s63
section.heading: Articles for producing material in particular typeface

subsection.content: This section applies to the copyright in an artistic work consisting of the design of a typeface where articles specifically designed or adapted for producing material in that typeface have been marketed by or with the licence of the copyright owner.

After the period of 25 years from the end of the calendar year in which the first such articles are marketed, the work may be copied by making further such articles, or doing anything for the purpose of making such articles, and anything may be done in relation to articles so made, without infringing copyright in the work.

subsection.def: In subsection (1) marketed (推出市場) means sold, let for hire or offered or exposed for sale or hire, in Hong Kong or elsewhere.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Transfers of copies of works in electronic form

subsection.content: This section applies where a copy of a work in electronic form (other than such a copy which was made available to the public) has been purchased on terms which, expressly or impliedly or by virtue of any rule of law, allow the purchaser to copy the work, or to adapt it or make copies of an adaptation, in connection with his use of it.

subsection.leadIn: If there are no express terms—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prohibiting the transfer of the copy by the purchaser, imposing obligations which continue after a transfer, prohibiting the assignment of any licence or terminating any licence on a transfer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing for the terms on which a transferee may do the things which the purchaser was permitted to do,

subsection.continued: anything which the purchaser was allowed to do may also be done without infringement of copyright by a transferee; but any copy, adaptation or copy of an adaptation made by the purchaser which is not also transferred is to be treated as an infringing copy for all purposes after the transfer.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) also applies where the original purchased copy is no longer usable and what is transferred is a further copy used in its place.
The above provisions also apply on a subsequent transfer, with the substitution for references in subsection (2) to the purchaser of references to the subsequent transferor.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Certain acts permitted where works communicated to the public
section.content: Notwithstanding section 23, copyright in a work is not infringed by the making of a transient and incidental copy which is technically required for the viewing or listening of the work by a member of the public to whom the work is communicated.

section.name: s65A
section.heading: Temporary reproduction by service providers

subsection.leadIn: The copyright in a work is not infringed by the making and storage of a copy of the work by a service provider if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sole purpose of the making and storage is to enable more efficient transmission of the work by the provider through a network;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the making and storage forms an automatic and essential part of a technological process, and that process neither modifies the work, nor interferes with the lawful use of technology to obtain data on the use of the work;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the storage is temporary;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the provider updates the database in which the copy is stored in accordance with reasonable industry practice;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the provider complies with conditions (if any) on access to the work; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the provider acts promptly to remove the copy or disable access to the copy in the event that either of the following facts comes to the provider’s actual knowledge—

subparagraph.content: the work has been removed from the original source from which the copy was made;
access to the work at the original source from which the copy was made has been disabled.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: online service (聯線服務) includes—(a)the transmission, routing, or provision of connections for digital online communications, between or among points specified by a user, of information or material of the user’s choosing;(b)the hosting of information or material that can be accessed by a user;(c)the storing of information or material on a system or network that can be accessed by a user;(d)the linking or referral of users to an online location by the use of information location tools; and(e)the provision of online social networking services to users;
routing (路由選擇) means directing or choosing the means or routes for the transmission of data;
service provider (服務提供者) means a person who, by means of electronic equipment or a network, or both, provides, or operates facilities for, any online services.

division.crossHeading: Miscellaneous: Literary, dramatic, musical and artistic works

section.name: s66
section.heading: Anonymous or pseudonymous works: acts permitted on assumptions as to expiry of copyright or death of author

subsection.leadIn: Copyright in a literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work is not infringed by an act done at a time when, or in pursuance of arrangements made at a time when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is not possible by reasonable inquiry to ascertain the identity of the author; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is reasonable to assume—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that copyright has expired; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that the author died 50 years or more before the beginning of the calendar year in which the act is done or the arrangements are made.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(b)(ii) does not apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a work in which Government copyright subsists; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a work in which copyright originally vested in an international organization by virtue of section 188 and in respect of which a regulation under that section specifies a copyright period longer than 50 years.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a work of joint authorship—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reference in subsection (1) to its being not possible to ascertain the identity of the author is to be construed as a reference to its being not possible to ascertain the identity of all of the authors; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reference in subsection (1)(b)(ii) to the author having died is to be construed as a reference to all the authors having died.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Use of notes or recordings of spoken words in certain cases

subsection.leadIn: Where a record of spoken words is made, in writing or otherwise, for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reporting current events; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: communicating the whole or part of the work to the public, (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 48)

subsection.continued: it is not an infringement of any copyright in the words as a literary work to use the record or material taken from it (or to copy the record, or any such material, and use the copy) for that purpose, if the conditions in subsection (2) are met.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the record is a direct record of the spoken words and is not taken from a previous record or from a broadcast or cable programme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the making of the record was not prohibited by the speaker and, where copyright already subsisted in the work, did not infringe copyright;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the use made of the record or material taken from it is not of a kind prohibited by or on behalf of the speaker or copyright owner before the record was made; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the use is by or with the authority of a person who is lawfully in possession of the record.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Public reading or recitation

subsection.content: The reading or recitation in public by one person of a reasonable extract from a published literary or dramatic work does not infringe any copyright in the work if it is accompanied by a sufficient acknowledgement.

Copyright in a work is not infringed by the making of a sound recording, or the communication to the public, of a reading or recitation which by virtue of subsection (1) does not infringe copyright in the work, if the recording or communication consists mainly of material in relation to which it is not necessary to rely on that subsection. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 49)

section.name: s69
section.heading: Abstracts of scientific or technical articles

subsection.content: Where an article on a scientific or technical subject is published in a periodical accompanied by an abstract indicating the contents of the article, it is not an infringement of copyright in the abstract, or in the article, to copy the abstract, communicate the abstract to the public or issue copies of the abstract to the public. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 50) [cf. 1988 c. 48 s. 60(1) U.K.]

This section does not apply if, or to the extent that, licences under licensing schemes are available authorizing the act in question and the person so acting knew or ought to have been aware of that fact.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Recordings of folksongs

subsection.content: A sound recording of a performance of a song may be made for the purpose of including it in an archive maintained by a body designated under subsection (4)(b) without infringing any copyright in the words as a literary work or in the accompanying musical work, if the conditions in subsection (2) below are met.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the words are unpublished and of unknown authorship at the time the recording is made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the making of the recording does not infringe any other copyright; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: its making is not prohibited by any performer.

subsection.content: Copies of a sound recording made in reliance on subsection (1) and included in an archive maintained by a body designated under subsection (4)(b) may, if the conditions prescribed under subsection (4)(a) are met, be made and supplied by the archivist without infringing copyright in the recording or the works included in it.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development may for the purposes of this section by regulation— (Amended L.N. 173 of 2000; L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prescribe conditions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: designate bodies, and he shall not designate a body unless he is satisfied that the body is not established or conducted for profit.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions prescribed under subsection (4)(a) must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that copies are only supplied to persons satisfying the archivist that they require them for the purposes of research or private study and will not use them for any other purpose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that no person is furnished with more than one copy of the same recording.

subsection.content: In this section, references to the archivist include a person acting on his behalf.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Representation of certain artistic works on public display

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: buildings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sculptures, models for buildings and works of artistic craftsmanship, if permanently situated in a public place or in premises open to the public.

subsection.leadIn: The copyright in such a work is not infringed by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: making a graphic work representing it;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: making a photograph or film of it; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: broadcasting or including in a cable programme service a visual image of it.

subsection.content: Nor is the copyright infringed by the communication to the public, or the issue to the public of copies, of anything whose making was, by virtue of this section, not an infringement of the copyright. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 52)

section.name: s72
section.heading: Advertisement of sale of artistic work

subsection.content: It is not an infringement of copyright in an artistic work to copy it, communicate it to the public or issue copies of it to the public, for the purpose of advertising the sale of the work.

Where a copy which would otherwise be an infringing copy is made in accordance with this section but is subsequently dealt with, the copy is treated as an infringing copy for the purposes of that dealing and, if that dealing infringes copyright, for all subsequent purposes. (Amended 15 of 2007 s. 20)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), a copy is dealt with if it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: possessed, exhibited in public or distributed (otherwise than for the purpose mentioned in subsection (1)) for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sold or let for hire, or offered or exposed for sale or hire. (Added 16 of 2022 s. 53)

section.name: s73
section.heading: Making of subsequent works by same artist
section.content: Where the author of an artistic work is not the copyright owner, he does not infringe the copyright by copying the work in making another artistic work if he does not repeat or imitate the main design of the earlier work.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Reconstruction of buildings
section.leadIn: Anything done for the purposes of reconstructing a building does not infringe any copyright—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the building; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any drawings or plans in accordance with which the building was, by or with the licence of the copyright owner, constructed.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Films: acts permitted on assumptions as to expiry of copyright, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Copyright in a film is not infringed by an act done at a time when, or in pursuance of arrangements made at a time when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is not possible by reasonable inquiry to ascertain the identity of any of the persons referred to in section 19(2)(a) to (d) (persons by reference to whose life the copyright period is ascertained); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is reasonable to assume—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that copyright has expired; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: that the last to die of those persons died 50 years or more before the beginning of the calendar year in which the act is done or the arrangements are made.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(b)(ii) does not apply in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a film in which Government copyright subsists; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a film in which copyright originally vested in an international organization by virtue of section 188 and in respect of which a regulation under that section specifies a copyright period longer than 50 years.

section.name: s76
section.heading: Performance, showing or playing of works for purposes of club, society, etc.

subsection.content: It is not an infringement of the copyright in a work (other than a broadcast or a cable programme) to perform, show or play it as part of the activities of, or for the benefit of, a club, society or other organization if the following conditions are met.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the club, society or organization is not established or conducted for profit and its main objects are charitable or are otherwise concerned with the advancement of religion, education or social welfare; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the proceeds of any charge for admission to the place where the work is to be performed, shown or played are applied solely for the purposes of the club, society or organization.

section.name: s76A
section.heading: Copying sound recordings for private and domestic use

subsection.leadIn: Copyright in a sound recording or in any literary, dramatic or musical work included in a sound recording is not infringed by the making of a copy of the sound recording (private copy) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the copy of the sound recording from which the private copy is made (original copy) is not an infringing copy;

paragraph.name: b
c
