The Chief Executive may, for the purpose of complying with the international obligations applicable to Hong Kong make regulation specifying a period longer than 50 years for the purposes of this section in relation to any international organization. (Amended 22 of 1999 s. 3)

section.name: s189
section.heading: Folklore, etc.: anonymous unpublished works

subsection.content: Where in the case of an unpublished literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work of unknown authorship there is evidence that the author (or, in the case of a joint work, any of the authors) was a qualifying individual by connection with a country, territory or area outside Hong Kong, it is presumed, until the contrary is proved, that he was such a qualifying individual and that copyright accordingly subsists in the work, subject to the provisions of this Part.

If under the law of that country, territory or area a body is appointed to protect and enforce copyright in such works, the Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development may by regulation designate that body for the purposes of this section. (Amended L.N. 173 of 2000; L.N. 106 of 2002; L.N. 130 of 2007)

A body so designated is recognized in Hong Kong as having authority to do in place of the copyright owner anything, other than assign copyright, which it is empowered to do under the law of that country, territory or area; and it may, in particular, bring proceedings in its own name. (Amended 21 of 2024 s. 110)

subsection.def: In subsection (1) a qualifying individual (合資格的個人) means an individual who at the material time (within the meaning of section 178) was a person whose works qualified under that section for copyright protection.

subsection.content: This section does not apply if there has been an assignment of copyright in the work by the author of which notice has been given to the designated body; and nothing in this section affects the validity of an assignment of copyright made, or licence granted, by the author or a person lawfully claiming under him.

section.name: s190
section.heading: Protection of Commissioner and authorized officers

subsection.content: The Commissioner and authorized officers are not liable for any loss or damage suffered by any person as a result of any action taken or omitted to be taken in good faith in connection with the carrying out of any of their duties under this Part.

The protection conferred by subsection (1) on the Commissioner and authorized officers in respect of any action taken or omitted to be taken in good faith in connection with the carrying out of those duties shall not affect in any manner any liability of the Government for that action taken or omitted to be taken.

section.name: s191
section.heading: Transitional provisions and savings
section.content: Schedule 2 contains transitional provisions and savings relating to works made, and acts or events occurring, before the commencement of this Part, and otherwise with respect to the operation of the provisions of this Part.

section.name: s192
section.heading: Rights and privileges under other enactments or the common law

subsection.leadIn: Nothing in this Part affects—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any right or privilege of any person under any enactment (except where the enactment is expressly repealed, amended or modified by this Ordinance);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any right or privilege of the Government subsisting otherwise than under an enactment;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any right or privilege of the Legislative Council;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the right of the Government or any person deriving title from the Government to sell, use or otherwise deal with the articles forfeited under the law of Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the operation of any rule of equity relating to breaches of trust or confidence.

subsection.content: Subject to those savings, no copyright or right in the nature of copyright subsists otherwise than by virtue of this Part or some other enactment in that behalf.
Nothing in this Part affects any rule of law preventing or restricting the enforcement of copyright, on grounds of public interest or otherwise.

Nothing in this Part affects any right of action or other remedy, whether civil or criminal, available otherwise than under this Part in respect of acts infringing any of the rights conferred by Division IV (moral rights).
The savings in subsection (1) have effect subject to sections 183(4) and 185(6) (copyright in Ordinances and bills: exclusion of other rights in the nature of copyright).

section.name: s193
section.heading: General provisions as to construction

subsection.content: This Part restates and amends the law of copyright, that is, the provisions of the Copyright Act 1956 (1956 c. 74 U.K.) as amended and extended to Hong Kong and the provisions of the Copyright Ordinance (Cap. 39), as amended.
A provision of this Part which corresponds to a provision of the previous law shall not be construed as departing from the previous law merely because of a change of expression.

Decisions under the previous law may be referred to for the purpose of establishing whether a provision of this Part departs from the previous law, or otherwise for establishing the true construction of this Part.

section.name: s194
section.heading: Construction of references to copyright owner

subsection.content: Where different persons are (whether in consequence of a partial assignment or otherwise) entitled to different aspects of copyright in a work, the copyright owner for any purpose of this Part is the person who is entitled to the aspect of copyright relevant for that purpose.

Where copyright (or any aspect of copyright) is owned by more than one person jointly, references in this Part to the copyright owner are to all the owners, so that, in particular, any requirement of the licence of the copyright owner requires the licence of all of them.

section.name: s195
section.heading: Meaning of educational establishment and related expressions

subsection.def: The expression educational establishment (教育機構) means an educational establishment specified in Schedule 1.
In relation to an educational establishment the expressions teacher (教師) and pupil (學生) in this Part include, respectively, any person who gives and any person who receives instruction.

subsection.content: References in this Part to anything being done on behalf of an educational establishment are to its being done for the purposes of that establishment by any person.
The Secretary for Education may, by notice in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1. (Amended L.N. 130 of 2007)

section.name: s196
section.heading: Meaning of publication and commercial publication

subsection.content: In this Part publication (發表), in relation to a work, means the issue or making available of copies of the work to the public; and related expressions are construed accordingly.

In this Part commercial publication (商業發表), in relation to a literary, dramatic, musical or artistic work means issuing or making available copies of the work to the public at a time when copies made in advance of the receipt of orders are generally available to the public, and related expressions are construed accordingly.
In the case of a work of architecture in the form of a building, or an artistic work incorporated in a building, construction of the building is treated as equivalent to publication of the work.

subsection.leadIn: The following do not constitute publication for the purposes of this Part and references to commercial publication are construed accordingly—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a literary, dramatic or musical work—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the performance of the work; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the broadcasting of the work or its inclusion in a cable programme service;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an artistic work—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the exhibition of the work;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the issue or making available to the public of copies of a graphic work representing, or of photographs of, a work of architecture in the form of a building or a model for a building, a sculpture or a work of artistic craftsmanship;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the issue or making available to the public of copies of a film including the work; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the broadcasting of the work or its inclusion in a cable programme service ;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a sound recording or film—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the work being played or shown in public; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the broadcasting of the work or its inclusion in a cable programme service.

subsection.content: References in this Part to publication or commercial publication do not include publication which is merely colourable and not intended to satisfy the reasonable requirements of the public.
No account is taken for the purposes of this section of any unauthorized act.

section.name: s197
section.heading: Requirement of signature: application in relation to body corporate

subsection.content: The requirement in the following provisions that an instrument be signed by or on behalf of a person is also satisfied in the case of a body corporate by the affixing of its seal—
section 101(3) (assignment of copyright);
section 102(1) (assignment of future copyright);
section 103(1) (grant of exclusive licence).
The requirement in the following provisions that an instrument be signed by a person is satisfied in the case of a body corporate by signature on behalf of the body or by the affixing of its seal—
section 90(2)(b) (assertion by instrument in writing of right to have author identified);
section 98(2) (waiver of moral rights).

section.name: s198
section.heading: Minor definitions

subsection.leadIn: In this Part— (Amended 64 of 2000 s. 10)

def.name: ArticleInTransit
def.leadIn: article in transit (過境物品) means an article which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is brought into Hong Kong solely for the purpose of taking it out of Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: remains at all times in or on the vessel or aircraft in or on which it is brought into Hong Kong;

subsection.def: authorized officer (獲授權人員) means any public officer authorized in writing by the Commissioner to exercise any of the powers and perform any of the duties conferred or imposed on an authorized officer under this Ordinance;

def.name: Business
def.leadIn: business (業務) includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a trade or profession; and

paragraph.name: b

def.name: CollectiveWork
def.leadIn: collective work (匯集作品) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a work of joint authorship; or

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: Commissioner (關長) means the Commissioner of Customs and Excise and any Deputy or Assistant Commissioner of Customs and Excise; (Replaced 22 of 1999 s. 3)
computer-generated (電腦產生), in relation to a work, means that the work is generated by computer in circumstances such that there is no human author of the work;
electronic (電子) means actuated by electric, magnetic, electro-magnetic, electro-chemical or electro-mechanical energy, and in electronic form (電子形式) means in a form usable only by electronic means;
employed (受僱), employee (僱員), employer (僱主) and employment (僱用) refer to employment under a contract of service or of apprenticeship;
facsimile copy (精確複製品) includes a copy which is reduced or enlarged in scale;
international organization (國際組織) means an organization the members of which include one or more countries, territories or areas;
judicial proceedings (司法程序) includes proceedings before any court, tribunal or person having authority to decide any matter affecting a person’s legal rights or liabilities;
movie (電影) means a film of the kind commonly known as a movie; (Added 27 of 2003 s. 5)

musical sound recording (音樂聲音紀錄) means a sound recording the whole or a predominant part of which consists of the whole or any part of a musical work or a musical work and a related literary work; (Added 27 of 2003 s. 5)

musical visual recording (音樂視像紀錄) means a film with an accompanying sound-track, the whole or a predominant part of which sound-track consists of the whole or any part of a musical work or a musical work and a related literary work; (Added 27 of 2003 s. 5)
producer (製作人), in relation to a sound recording or a film, means the person by whom the arrangements necessary for the making of the sound recording or film are undertaken;

def.name: RentalRight
def.leadIn: rental right (租賃權) means the right of a copyright owner to authorize or prohibit the rental of copies of any of the following works—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a computer program;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a sound recording;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a film;

paragraph.name: d

subsection.def: reprographic copy (翻印複製品) refers to a copy made by means of a reprographic process;

def.name: ReprographicProcess
def.leadIn: reprographic process (翻印程序) means a process—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for making facsimile copies; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: involving the use of an appliance for making multiple copies,

def.name: SpecifiedCourseOfStudy
def.leadIn: specified course of study (指明課程) means a course of study of any of the following descriptions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a course of study which is provided for the delivery of a curriculum (however described) developed on the basis of curriculum guidelines issued or endorsed by a body or authority specified in Schedule 1A; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a course of study which consists of an assessment of a pupil’s competence in the area covered by the course, and leads to the award of a qualification; (Added 15 of 2007 s. 47)

def.name: SufficientAcknowledgement
def.leadIn: sufficient acknowledgement (足夠的確認聲明) means an acknowledgement identifying the work in question by its title or other description, and identifying the author unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a published work, it is published anonymously;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of an unpublished work, it is not possible for a person to ascertain the identity of the author by reasonable inquiry;

def.name: SufficientDisclaimer
def.leadIn: sufficient disclaimer (足夠的卸責聲明), in relation to an act capable of infringing the right conferred by section 92 (right to object to derogatory treatment of work), means a clear and reasonably prominent indication—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: given at the time of the act; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the author or director is then identified, appearing along with the identification,

def.continued: that the work has been subjected to treatment to which the author or director has not consented;

subsection.def: telecommunications system (電訊系統) means a system for transmitting visual images, sounds or other information by electronic means;
television drama (電視劇或電視電影) means a film of the kind commonly known as a television drama; (Added 27 of 2003 s. 5)

def.name: Unauthorized
def.leadIn: unauthorized (未經授權), as regards anything done in relation to a work, means done otherwise than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by or with the licence of the copyright owner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if copyright does not subsist in the work, by or with the licence of the author or, in a case where section 14(1) would have applied, the author’s employer or, in either case, persons lawfully claiming under him; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in pursuance of section 57 (copying, etc. of certain material by the Government);

subsection.def: wireless telegraphy (無線電訊) means the sending of electro-magnetic energy over paths which are not provided by any material substance constructed or arranged for that purpose;

writing (書面) includes any form of notation or code, whether by hand or otherwise and regardless of the method by which, or medium in or on which, it is recorded, and written (寫出) is construed accordingly.

In sections 31(2), 32(3), 95(1A), 96(6A), 109(1A) and 120(2A), dealing in (經營) includes buying, selling, letting for hire, importing, exporting and distributing. (Added 64 of 2000 s. 10. Amended 15 of 2007 s. 47)

def.name: LawfullyMade
def.leadIn: In this Part, lawfully made (合法地製作), in relation to a copy of a work made in a country, territory or area—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: means that the copy was made by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a person who is entitled to the copyright in the work in the country, territory or area, as the case may be; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person who is licensed by the person referred to in subparagraph (i) to make the copy in the country, territory or area, as the case may be; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include a copy that was made in a country, territory or area where there is no law protecting copyright in the work or where the copyright in the work has expired. (Replaced 15 of 2007 s. 47)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: A note in the text of this Part is for information only and has no legislative effect. (Added 16 of 2022 s. 74)
The Secretary for Commerce and Economic Development may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1A. (Added 15 of 2007 s. 47)

division.name: D1
division.heading: The Rights, Infringement of the Rights and Remedies for Infringement

section.name: s200
section.heading: Rights conferred on performers and persons having fixation rights

subsection.leadIn: This Part confers rights—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on a performer, by requiring his consent to the exploitation of his performances and thus enabling him to prohibit such exploitation without his consent (see sections 201 to 207A); and (Amended 15 of 2007 s. 49)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on a person having fixation rights in relation to a performance, in relation to fixations made without his consent or that of the performer (see sections 208 to 211).

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: Fixation
def.leadIn: fixation (錄製品、錄製), in relation to a performance, means a film or sound recording—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: made directly from the unfixed performance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: made from a communication to the public that includes the performance; or (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 76)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: made, directly or indirectly, from another fixation of the performance;

def.name: Performance
def.leadIn: performance (表演) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a dramatic performance (which includes dance and mime);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a musical performance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a reading or recitation of a literary work;

paragraph.name: ca
cb
paragraph.content: an expression of folklore; or (Added 15 of 2007 s. 49)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a performance of a variety act or any similar presentation,

def.continued: which is, or so far as it is, an unfixed performance given by one or more individuals;

subsection.def: performer (表演者) means an actor, singer, musician, dancer or any other person who acts, sings, delivers, declaims, plays in, interprets, or otherwise performs a performance.

subsection.leadIn: The rights conferred by this Part are independent of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any copyright in, or moral rights relating to, any work performed or any film or sound recording of, or broadcast or cable programme including, the performance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other right or obligation arising otherwise than under this Part.

section.name: s201
section.heading: Qualifying performances
section.content: A performance is a qualifying performance for the purposes of the provisions of this Part relating to performers’ rights if it is given in Hong Kong or elsewhere by an individual domiciled or resident or having a right of abode in Hong Kong or elsewhere.

section.name: s202
section.heading: Consent required for fixation, etc. of unfixed performance

subsection.leadIn: A performer’s rights are infringed by a person who, without the performer’s consent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes a fixation of the whole or any substantial part of a qualifying performance directly from the unfixed performance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: communicates to the public live the whole or any substantial part of a qualifying performance; or (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 77)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: makes a fixation of the whole or any substantial part of a qualifying performance directly from a communication to the public that includes the unfixed performance. (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 77)

subsection.content: A performer’s rights are not infringed by the making of any such fixation by a person for his private and domestic use.

In an action for infringement of a performer’s rights brought by virtue of this section damages shall not be awarded against a defendant who shows that at the time of the infringement he believed on reasonable grounds that consent had been given.

section.name: s203
section.heading: Consent required for copying of fixation

subsection.content: A performer’s rights are infringed by a person who, without the performer’s consent, makes, otherwise than for his private and domestic use, a copy of a fixation of the whole or any substantial part of a qualifying performance; and references in this Part to copying and copies are construed as follows.
It is immaterial whether the copy is made directly or indirectly.

Making of a copy of a fixation means reproducing the fixation in any material form. This includes storing the fixation in any medium by electronic means, and making a copy that is transient or is incidental to some other use of the fixation. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 78)

subsection.def: The right of a performer under this section to authorize or prohibit the making of such copies is referred to in this Part as the right of reproduction (複製權). (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019)

section.name: s204
section.heading: Consent required for issue of copies to public

subsection.content: A performer’s rights are infringed by a person who, without the performer’s consent, issues to the public copies of a fixation of the whole or any substantial part of a qualifying performance.

References in this Part to the issue to the public of copies of a fixation are to the act of putting into circulation copies not previously put into circulation, in Hong Kong or elsewhere, by or with the consent of the performer.

subsection.leadIn: References in this Part to the issue to the public of copies of a fixation do not include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any subsequent distribution, sale, hiring or loan of copies previously put into circulation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any subsequent importation of such copies into Hong Kong.

subsection.content: References in this Part to the issue of copies of a fixation of a performance include the issue of the original fixation of the unfixed performance.

subsection.def: The right of a performer under this section to authorize or prohibit the issue of copies to the public is referred to in this Part as the right of distribution (分發權利). (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019)

section.name: s205
section.heading: Consent required for making available of fixations to public

subsection.content: A performer’s rights are infringed by a person who, without the performer’s consent, makes available to the public a fixation of the whole or any substantial part of a qualifying performance.

References in this Part to making a fixation of a performance available to the public are references to making the fixation available, by wire or wireless means, in such a way that members of the public in Hong Kong or elsewhere may access the fixation from a place and at a time individually chosen by them (such as by making fixations available through the Internet).

The mere provision of facilities by any person for enabling or facilitating the making available of a fixation of a performance to the public does not of itself constitute an act of making the fixation available to the public. (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 79)

subsection.def: The right of a performer under this section to authorize or prohibit the making available of a fixation to the public is referred to in this Part as the right of making available to the public (向公眾提供的權利). (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019)

section.name: s206
section.heading: Infringement of performer’s rights by use of fixation made without consent

subsection.leadIn: A performer’s rights are infringed by a person who, without the performer’s consent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shows or plays in public the whole or any substantial part of a qualifying performance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: communicates to the public the whole or any substantial part of a qualifying performance, (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 80)

subsection.continued: by means of a fixation which was, and which that person knows or has reason to believe was, made without the performer’s consent.

section.name: s207
section.heading: Infringement of performer’s rights by importing, exporting, possessing or dealing with infringing fixation

subsection.leadIn: A performer’s rights are infringed by a person who, without the performer’s consent—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: imports into Hong Kong or exports from Hong Kong, otherwise than for his private and domestic use; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business— (Amended 15 of 2007 s. 50)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: possesses;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: makes available to the public;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sells or lets for hire;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: offers or exposes for sale or hire; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: distributes, (Replaced 64 of 2000 s. 12)

subsection.continued: a fixation of a qualifying performance which is, and which that person knows or has reason to believe is, an infringing fixation.

subsection.name: 1a
subsection.content: It is immaterial for the purpose of subsection (1)(b) whether or not the trade or business consists of dealing in infringing fixations. (Added 64 of 2000 s. 12)

Where in an action for infringement of a performer’s rights brought by virtue of this section a defendant shows that the infringing fixation was innocently acquired by him or a predecessor in title of his, the only remedy available against him in respect of the infringement is damages not exceeding a reasonable payment in respect of the act complained of.

subsection.def: In subsection (2) innocently acquired (不知情地取得) means that the person acquiring the fixation did not know and had no reason to believe that it was an infringing fixation.

section.name: s207A
section.heading: Infringement of performers’ rights by renting copies to the public without consent

subsection.content: A performer’s rights are infringed by a person who, without the performer’s consent, rents to the public copies of a sound recording in which the whole or any substantial part of a qualifying performance is fixed.

def.name: Rent
def.leadIn: In this Part, rent (租賃), in relation to a sound recording—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), means making a copy of the sound recording available for use, on terms that it will or may be returned, for direct or indirect economic or commercial advantage;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: does not include—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: making a copy of the sound recording available for the purpose of public performance, playing or showing in public or communicating to the public; (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 81)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: making a copy of the sound recording available for the purpose of exhibition in public; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: making a copy of the sound recording available for on-the-spot reference use.

subsection.content: A reference in this Part to the renting of copies of a sound recording includes the renting of the original.
The right of a performer under this section to rent copies of a sound recording to the public is referred to in this Part as rental right (租賃權). (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019)

division.crossHeading: Rights of person having fixation rights

section.name: s208
section.heading: Exclusive fixation contracts and persons having fixation rights

subsection.def: In this Part an exclusive fixation contract (獨有錄製合約) means a contract between a performer and another person under which that person is entitled to the exclusion of all other persons (including the performer) to make fixations of one or more of the performer’s performances with a view to their commercial exploitation.

def.name: PersonHavingFixationRights
def.leadIn: References in this Part to a person having fixation rights (具有錄製權的人), in relation to a performance, are (subject to subsection (3)) to a person— (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is a party to and has the benefit of an exclusive fixation contract to which the performance is subject; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to whom the benefit of such a contract has been assigned,

def.continued: and who is a qualifying person.

def.name: PersonHavingFixationRights
def.leadIn: If a performance is subject to an exclusive fixation contract but the person mentioned in subsection (2) is not a qualifying person, references in this Part to a person having fixation rights (具有錄製權的人)in relation to the performance are to any person— (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is licensed by such a person to make fixations of the performance with a view to their commercial exploitation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to whom the benefit of such a licence has been assigned,

def.continued: and who is a qualifying person.

subsection.def: In this section with a view to commercial exploitation (以期作商業利用) means with a view to the fixations being sold or let for hire, or shown or played in public, or issued or made available to the public.

section.name: s209
section.heading: Consent required for fixation of performance subject to exclusive contract

subsection.content: A person infringes the rights of a person having fixation rights in relation to a performance who, without the latter’s consent or that of the performer, makes a fixation of the whole or any substantial part of the performance, otherwise than for his private and domestic use.

In an action for infringement of those rights brought by virtue of this section damages shall not be awarded against a defendant who shows that at the time of the infringement he believed on reasonable grounds that consent had been given.

section.name: s210
section.heading: Infringement of fixation rights by use of fixation made without consent

subsection.leadIn: A person infringes the rights of a person having fixation rights in relation to a performance who, without the latter’s consent or, in the case of a qualifying performance, that of the performer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shows or plays in public the whole or any substantial part of the performance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: communicates to the public the whole or any substantial part of the performance, (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 82)

subsection.continued: by means of a fixation which was, and which that person knows or has reason to believe was, made without the appropriate consent.

def.name: TheAppropriateConsent
def.leadIn: The reference in subsection (1) to the appropriate consent (適當的同意) is to the consent of— (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019; 16 of 2022 s. 82)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the performer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person who at the time the consent was given had fixation rights in relation to the performance (or, if there was more than one such person, of all of them).

section.name: s211
section.heading: Infringement of fixation rights by importing, exporting, possessing or dealing with infringing fixation

subsection.leadIn: A person infringes the rights of a person having fixation rights in relation to a performance who, without the latter’s consent or, in the case of a qualifying performance, that of the performer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: imports into Hong Kong or exports from Hong Kong, otherwise than for his private and domestic use; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business— (Amended 15 of 2007 s. 52)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: possesses;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: makes available to the public;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: sells or lets for hire;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: offers or exposes for sale or hire; or

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: distributes, (Replaced 64 of 2000 s. 13)

subsection.continued: a fixation of the performance which is, and which that person knows or has reason to believe is, an infringing fixation.

subsection.name: 1a
subsection.content: It is immaterial for the purpose of subsection (1)(b) whether or not the trade or business consists of dealing in infringing fixations. (Added 64 of 2000 s. 13)

Where in an action for infringement of those rights brought by virtue of this section a defendant shows that the infringing fixation was innocently acquired by him or a predecessor in title of his, the only remedy available against him in respect of the infringement is damages not exceeding a reasonable payment in respect of the act complained of.

subsection.def: In subsection (2) innocently acquired (不知情地取得) means that the person acquiring the fixation did not know and had no reason to believe that it was an infringing fixation.

section.name: s212
section.heading: Acts permitted notwithstanding rights conferred by this Division
section.content: The provisions of Division II specify acts which may be done notwithstanding the rights conferred by this Part, being acts which correspond broadly to certain of those specified in Division III of Part II (acts permitted notwithstanding copyright).

section.name: s213
section.heading: Power of Tribunal to give consent on behalf of owner of right of reproduction in certain cases

subsection.content: The Copyright Tribunal may, on the application of a person wishing to make a copy of a fixation of a performance, give consent in a case where the identity or whereabouts of the person entitled to the right of reproduction cannot be ascertained by reasonable inquiry.

Consent given by the Tribunal has effect as consent of the person entitled to the right of reproduction for the purposes of the provision of this Part relating to performers’ rights and may be given subject to any conditions specified in the Tribunal’s order.

The Tribunal shall not give consent under subsection (1) except after the service of such notices as may be required by rules made under section 174 (general procedural rules) or as the Tribunal may in any particular case direct.

subsection.leadIn: In any case the Tribunal shall take into account the following factors—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the original fixation was made with the performer’s consent and is lawfully in the possession or control of the person proposing to make the further fixation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the making of the further fixation is consistent with the obligations of the parties to the arrangements under which, or is otherwise consistent with the purposes for which, the original fixation was made.

subsection.content: Where the Tribunal gives consent under this section it shall, in default of agreement between the applicant and the person entitled to the right of reproduction, make such order as it thinks fit as to the payment to be made to that person in consideration of consent being given.

section.name: s213A
section.heading: Power of Tribunal to give consent on behalf of owners of performers’ rental right in certain cases

subsection.content: The Copyright Tribunal may, on the application of a person wishing to rent a copy of a sound recording in which a performance is fixed, give consent in a case where that person cannot, after making reasonable enquiries, ascertain the identity or whereabouts of the person entitled to the rental right.

Consent given by the Tribunal has effect as consent of the person entitled to the rental right for the purposes of the provision of this Part relating to performers’ rental right and may be given subject to any conditions specified in the Tribunal’s order.

The Tribunal shall not give consent under subsection (1) except after the service of such notices as may be required by rules made under section 174 (general procedural rules) or as the Tribunal may in any particular case direct.

Where the Tribunal gives consent under this section, it shall, in default of agreement between the applicant and the person entitled to the rental right, make such order as it thinks fit as to the payment to be made to that person in consideration of consent being given.

section.name: s214
section.heading: Duration of rights

subsection.content: The following provisions have effect with respect to the duration of the rights conferred by this Part.

subsection.leadIn: The rights conferred by this Part in relation to a performance expire—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the end of the period of 50 years from the end of the calendar year in which the performance takes place; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if during that period a fixation of the performance is released, 50 years from the end of the calendar year in which it is released,

subsection.continued: subject as follows.

subsection.def: For the purposes of subsection (2) a fixation is released (發行) when it is first published, played or shown in public or communicated to the public; but in determining whether a fixation has been released no account shall be taken of any unauthorized act. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019; 16 of 2022 s. 83)

section.name: s215
section.heading: Performers’ economic rights

subsection.leadIn: The following rights conferred by this Part on a performer are property rights (a performer’s economic rights)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the right of reproduction (section 203);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the right of distribution (section 204);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the right of making available to the public (section 205);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the rental right (section 207A). (Replaced 15 of 2007 s. 54)

subsection.content: References in this Part to the consent of the performer are to be construed in relation to a performer’s economic rights as references to the consent of the rights owner.

Where different persons are (whether in consequence of a partial assignment or otherwise) entitled to different aspects of a performer’s economic rights in relation to a performance, the rights owner for any purpose of this Part is the person who is entitled to the aspect of those rights relevant for that purpose.

Where a performer’s economic rights (or any aspect of them) is owned by more than one person jointly, references in this Part to the rights owner are to all the owners, so that, in particular, any requirement of the licence of the rights owner requires the licence of all of them.

section.name: s216
section.heading: Assignment and licences

subsection.content: A performer’s economic rights are transmissible by assignment, by testamentary disposition or by operation of law, as personal or moveable property.

subsection.leadIn: An assignment or other transmission of a performer’s economic rights may be partial, that is, limited so as to apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to one or more, but not all, of the things requiring the consent of the rights owner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to part, but not the whole, of the period for which the rights are to subsist.

subsection.content: An assignment of a performer’s economic rights is not effective unless it is in writing signed by or on behalf of the assignor.

A licence granted by the owner of a performer’s economic rights is binding on every successor in title to his interest in the rights, except a purchaser in good faith for valuable consideration and without notice (actual or constructive) of the licence or a person deriving title from such a purchaser; and references in this Part to doing anything with, or without, the licence of the rights owner are to be construed accordingly.

section.name: s217
section.heading: Prospective ownership of a performer’s economic rights

subsection.content: This section applies where by an agreement made in relation to a future fixation of a performance, and signed by or on behalf of the performer, the performer purports to assign his performer’s economic rights (wholly or partially) to another person.

If on the rights coming into existence the assignee or another person claiming under him would be entitled as against all other persons to require the rights to be vested in him, they shall vest in the assignee or his successor in title by virtue of this subsection.

A licence granted by a prospective owner of a performer’s economic rights is binding on every successor in title to his interest (or prospective interest) in the rights, except a purchaser in good faith for valuable consideration and without notice (actual or constructive) of the licence or a person deriving title from such a purchaser.
References in this Part to doing anything with, or without, the licence of the rights owner are to be construed accordingly.

subsection.def: In subsection (3) prospective owner (準擁有人), in relation to a performer’s economic rights, means a person who is prospectively entitled to those rights, by virtue of such an agreement as is mentioned in subsection (1).

section.name: s218
section.heading: Exclusive licences

subsection.def: In this Part an exclusive licence (專用特許) means a licence in writing signed by or on behalf of the owner of a performer’s economic rights authorizing the licensee to the exclusion of all other persons, including the person granting the licence, to do anything requiring the consent of the rights owner.

subsection.content: The licensee under an exclusive licence has the same rights against a successor in title who is bound by the licence as he has against the person granting the licence.

section.name: s219
section.heading: Performer’s economic right to pass under will with unpublished original fixation
section.content: Where under a bequest (whether general or specific) a person is entitled beneficially or otherwise to any material thing containing an original fixation of a performance which was not published before the death of the testator, the bequest is, unless a contrary intention is indicated in the testator’s will or a codicil to it, to be construed as including any performer’s rights in relation to the fixation to which the testator was entitled immediately before his death.

section.name: s220
section.heading: Infringement actionable by rights owner

subsection.content: An infringement of a performer’s economic rights or of any right conferred by this Part on a person having fixation rights is actionable by the rights owner.

In an action for infringement of a performer’s economic rights or of any right conferred by this Part on a person having fixation rights all such relief by way of damages, injunctions, accounts or otherwise is available to the plaintiff as is available in respect of the infringement of any other property right.
This section has effect subject to the following provisions of this Part.

section.name: s221
section.heading: Provisions as to damages in infringement action

subsection.content: Where in an action for infringement of a performer’s economic rights or of any right conferred by this Part on a person having fixation rights it is shown that at the time of the infringement the defendant did not know, and had no reason to believe, that the rights subsisted in the fixation to which the action relates, the plaintiff is not entitled to damages against him, but without prejudice to any other remedy.

subsection.leadIn: The court may in an action for infringement of a performer’s economic rights or of any right conferred by this Part on a person having fixation rights having regard to all the circumstances, and in particular to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the flagrancy of the infringement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any benefit accruing to the defendant by reason of the infringement; (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 84)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the completeness, accuracy and reliability of the defendant’s business accounts and records; (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 84)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any unreasonable conduct of the defendant after the act constituting the infringement occurred, including any act done or attempt made by the defendant to destroy, conceal or disguise evidence of the infringement after having been informed of the infringement by the plaintiff; and (Added 16 of 2022 s. 84)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the likelihood of widespread circulation of infringing copies as a result of the infringement, (Added 16 of 2022 s. 84)

subsection.continued: award such additional damages as the justice of the case may require.

section.name: s222
section.heading: Right and remedies for exclusive licensee

subsection.content: An exclusive licensee has, except against the owner of a performer’s economic rights, the same rights and remedies in respect of matters occurring after the grant of the licence as if the licence had been an assignment.
His rights and remedies are concurrent with those of the rights owner; and references in the relevant provisions of this Part to the rights owner are to be construed accordingly.

In an action brought by an exclusive licensee by virtue of this section a defendant may avail himself of any defence which would have been available to him if the action had been brought by the rights owner.

section.name: s223
section.heading: Exercise of concurrent rights

subsection.content: Where an action for infringement of a performer’s economic rights brought by the rights owner or an exclusive licensee relates (wholly or partly) to an infringement in respect of which they have concurrent rights of action, the rights owner or, as the case may be, the exclusive licensee may not, without the leave of the court, proceed with the action unless the other is either joined as plaintiff or added as a defendant.
A rights owner or exclusive licensee who is added as a defendant in pursuance of subsection (1) is not liable for any costs in the action unless he takes part in the proceedings.
The above provisions do not affect the granting of interlocutory relief on an application by the rights owner or exclusive licensee alone.

subsection.leadIn: Where an action for infringement of a performer’s economic rights is brought which relates (wholly or partly) to an infringement in respect of which the rights owner and an exclusive licensee have or had concurrent rights of action—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the court shall in assessing damages take into account—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the terms of the licence; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any pecuniary remedy already awarded or available to either of them in respect of the infringement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no account of profits shall be directed if an award of damages has been made, or an account of profits has been directed, in favour of the other of them in respect of the infringement; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the court shall if an account of profits is directed apportion the profits between them as the court considers just, subject to any agreement between them,

subsection.continued: and these provisions apply whether or not the rights owner and the exclusive licensee are both parties to the action.

subsection.content: The owner of a performer’s economic rights shall notify any exclusive licensee having concurrent rights before applying for an order under section 228 (order for delivery up); and the court may on the application of the licensee make such order under section 228 as it thinks fit having regard to the terms of the licence.

section.name: s224
section.heading: Performers’ non-economic rights

subsection.text: The rights conferred on a performer by—
section 202 (consent required for fixation, etc. of unfixed performance);
section 206 (infringement of performer’s rights by use of fixation made without consent); and
section 207 (infringement of performer’s rights by importing, exporting, possessing or dealing with infringing fixation),
subsection.continued: are not assignable or transmissible, except to the following extent.
They are referred to in this Part as a performer’s non-economic rights.

subsection.leadIn: On the death of a person entitled to any such right—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the right passes to such person as he may by testamentary disposition specifically direct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if or to the extent that there is no such direction, the right is exercisable by his personal representatives.

subsection.content: References in this Part to the performer, in the context of the person having any such right, are to be construed as references to the person for the time being entitled to exercise those rights.
Where by virtue of subsection (2)(a) a right becomes exercisable by more than one person, it is exercisable by each of them independently of the other or others.

Any damages recovered by personal representatives by virtue of this section in respect of an infringement after a person’s death devolves as part of his estate as if the right of action had subsisted and been vested in him immediately before his death.

section.name: s225
section.heading: Transmissibility of rights of person having fixation rights

subsection.content: The rights conferred by this Part on a person having fixation rights are not assignable or transmissible.
This does not affect section 208(2)(b) or (3)(b), so far as those provisions confer rights under this Part on a person to whom the benefit of a contract or licence is assigned.

section.name: s226
section.heading: Consent

subsection.content: Consent for the purposes of this Part by a person having a performer’s non-economic rights, or by a person having fixation rights, may be given in relation to a specific performance, to a specified description of performances or to performances generally, and may relate to past or future performances.

A person having fixation rights in a performance is bound by any consent given by a person through whom he derives his rights under the exclusive fixation contract or licence in question, in the same way as if the consent had been given by him.

Where a performer’s non-economic right passes to another person, any consent binding on the person previously entitled binds the person to whom the right passes in the same way as if the consent had been given by him.

section.name: s227
section.heading: Infringement actionable
section.content: An infringement of a performer’s non-economic rights is actionable as a breach of statutory duty owed to the person entitled to the rights.

section.name: s228
section.heading: Order for delivery up

subsection.content: Where a person has in his possession, custody or control for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business an infringing fixation of a performance, a person having performer’s rights or fixation rights in relation to the performance under this Part may apply to the court for an order that the fixation be delivered up to him or to such other person as the court may direct. (Amended 64 of 2000 s. 14; 15 of 2007 s. 55)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: It is immaterial for the purpose of subsection (1) whether or not the trade or business consists of dealing in infringing fixations. (Added 64 of 2000 s. 14)

An application may not be made after the end of the period specified in section 230; and the court shall not make an order unless the court also makes, or it appears to the court that there are grounds for making, an order under section 231 (order as to disposal of infringing fixation).

A person to whom a fixation is delivered up in pursuance of an order under this section shall, if an order under section 231 is not made, retain it pending the making of an order, or the decision not to make an order, under that section.
Nothing in this section affects any other power of the court.

section.name: s229
section.heading: Meaning of infringing fixation

subsection.content: In this Part infringing fixation (侵犯權利的錄製品), in relation to a performance, is to be construed in accordance with this section.

For the purposes of a performer’s rights, a fixation of the whole or any substantial part of a performance of his is an infringing fixation if it is made, otherwise than for private and domestic use, without his consent. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 85)

For the purposes of the rights of a person having fixation rights, a fixation of the whole or any substantial part of a performance subject to the exclusive fixation contract is an infringing fixation if it is made, otherwise than for private and domestic use, without his consent or that of the performer. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 85)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: If a fixation lawfully made for private and domestic use under this Part is used for any other purpose, the fixation is to be treated as an infringing fixation. (Added 16 of 2022 s. 85)

subsection.leadIn: Except as provided in section 229A, a fixation of a performance is also an infringing fixation if— (Amended 15 of 2007 s. 56)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it has been or is proposed to be imported into Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its making in Hong Kong would have constituted an infringement of the rights conferred by this Part in the performance in question, or a breach of an exclusive licence agreement relating to that performance.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of Division III (proceedings relating to importation of infringing fixations) infringing fixation (侵犯權利的錄製品) does not include a fixation of a performance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that was lawfully made in the country, territory or area where it was made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that has been or is proposed to be imported into Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: its making in Hong Kong would have constituted an infringement of the rights conferred by this Part in the performance in question, or a breach of an exclusive licence agreement relating to that performance.

subsection.leadIn: Where in any proceedings the question arises whether a fixation is an infringing fixation and it is shown—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the fixation is a fixation of the unfixed performance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that rights conferred by this Part subsist in the performance or have subsisted at any time,

subsection.continued: it shall be presumed until the contrary is proved that the fixation was made at a time when rights conferred by this Part subsisted in the performance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part, infringing fixation (侵犯權利的錄製品) includes a fixation which is to be treated as an infringing fixation by virtue of any of the following provisions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 229A(5) (imported fixation not an infringing fixation for purposes of section 229(4));

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 242A(3) (fixations made for purposes of giving or receiving instruction);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 243(3) (fixations made for purposes of instruction or examination);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 245(3) (fixations made by educational establishments for educational purposes);

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: section 245A(4) (fixations made by educational establishments for educational purposes); (Added 16 of 2022 s. 85)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: section 246A(3) (fixations made for purposes of public administration);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: section 251(2) (fixations of performance in electronic form retained on transfer of principal fixation); or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: section 256(3) (fixations made for purposes of broadcast or cable programme). (Replaced 15 of 2007 s. 56)

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (5)(a), lawfully made (合法地製作), in relation to a fixation of a performance made in a country, territory or area—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: means that the fixation was made by—

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person having fixation rights in relation to the performance in the country, territory or area, as the case may be; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: a person having the consent of the performer or the person referred to in paragraph (ii) to make the fixation in the country, territory or area, as the case may be; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include a fixation that was made in a country, territory or area where there is no law protecting rights in performances in the performance or where the rights in performances in the performance has expired. (Replaced 15 of 2007 s. 56)

section.name: s229A
section.heading: Imported fixation not an infringing fixation for the purposes of section 229(4)

subsection.leadIn: A fixation of a performance to which this subsection applies is not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the person who imports it into Hong Kong, an infringing fixation for the purposes of section 229(4) if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it was lawfully made in the country, territory or area where it was made; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is not imported with a view to its being dealt in by any person for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to the person who possesses it, an infringing fixation for the purposes of section 229(4) if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it was lawfully made in the country, territory or area where it was made; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is not possessed with a view to its being dealt in by any person for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies to a fixation of any performance except a fixation of a performance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a musical sound recording;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a musical visual recording;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a television drama; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: a movie; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is, or is intended to be, played or shown in public.

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding the exception in subsection (2), subsection (1) applies to a fixation of a performance that is referred to in subsection (2)(a) and that is, or is intended to be, played or shown in public—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by an educational establishment for the educational purposes of the establishment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by a specified library for use of the library.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsection (3)(b), a library is regarded as a specified library if it falls within the description of any library specified under section 46(1)(b).

Where a fixation of a performance which is not an infringing fixation by virtue of subsection (1) is subsequently dealt in for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business, it is to be treated, in relation to that dealing and the person who deals in it, as an infringing fixation.

def.name: LawfullyMade
def.leadIn: In this section, lawfully made (合法地製作), in relation to a fixation of a performance made in a country, territory or area—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: means that the fixation was made by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the performer;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a person having fixation rights in relation to the performance in the country, territory or area, as the case may be; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: a person having the consent of the performer or the person referred to in subparagraph (ii) to make the fixation in the country, territory or area, as the case may be; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include a fixation that was made in a country, territory or area where there is no law protecting rights in performances in the performance or where the rights in performances in the performance has expired.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (6), expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 35B.

division.crossHeading: Supplementary provisions with respect to delivery up

section.name: s230
section.heading: Period after which remedy of delivery up not available

subsection.content: An application for an order under section 228 (order for delivery up in civil proceedings) may not be made after the end of the period of 6 years from the date on which the infringing fixation in question was made, subject to the following provisions of this section.

subsection.leadIn: If during the whole or any part of that period a person entitled to apply for an order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is under a disability; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is prevented by fraud or concealment from discovering the facts entitling him to apply,

subsection.continued: an application may be made by him at any time before the end of the period of 6 years from the date on which he ceased to be under a disability or, as the case may be, could with reasonable diligence have discovered those facts.

subsection.def: In subsection (2) disability (無行為能力) has the same meaning as in the Limitation Ordinance (Cap. 347).

section.name: s231
section.heading: Order as to disposal of infringing fixation

subsection.leadIn: An application may be made to the court for an order that an infringing fixation of a performance delivered up in pursuance of an order under section 228 should be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: forfeited to such person having performer’s rights or fixation rights in relation to the performance as the court may direct; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: destroyed or otherwise dealt with as the court may think fit,

subsection.continued: or for a decision that no such order should be made.

subsection.content: In considering what order (if any) should be made, the court shall consider whether other remedies available in an action for infringement of the rights conferred by this Part would be adequate to compensate the person or persons entitled to the rights and to protect their interests.
The power to make rules of court under section 54 of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4) includes power to make rules of court for the purposes of this section. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: The rules of court for the purposes of this section may include rules as to the service of notice on persons having an interest in the fixation, and any such person is entitled—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to appear in proceedings for an order under this section, whether or not he was served with notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to appeal against any order made, whether or not he appeared.

subsection.content: An order under this section does not take effect until the end of the period within which notice of an appeal may be given or, if before the end of that period notice of appeal is duly given, until the final determination or abandonment of the proceedings on the appeal.

Where there is more than one person interested in a fixation, the court shall make such order as it thinks just and may (in particular) direct that the fixation be sold, or otherwise dealt with, and the proceeds divided.
If the court decides that no order should be made under this section, the person in whose possession, custody or control the fixation was before being delivered up is entitled to its return.

References in this section to a person having an interest in a fixation include any person in whose favour an order could be made in respect of the fixation under this section or under section 111 (which makes similar provision in relation to infringement of copyright).

section.name: s232
section.heading: Jurisdiction of District Court

subsection.leadIn: The District Court may entertain proceedings under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 228 (order for delivery up of infringing fixation); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 231 (order as to disposal of infringing fixation),

subsection.continued: where the value of the infringing fixation in question does not exceed the limit for actions in tort set out in section 32(1) of the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336). (Amended 28 of 2000 s. 45)

subsection.content: Nothing in this section affects the jurisdiction of the Court of First Instance. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

section.name: s233
section.heading: Jurisdiction of Copyright Tribunal

subsection.leadIn: The Copyright Tribunal has jurisdiction under this Part to hear and determine proceedings under—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 213 (application to give consent on behalf of owner of the right of reproduction);

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.content: section 213A (application to give consent on behalf of owners of performers’ rental right); (Added 15 of 2007 s. 58)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: paragraph 6 of Schedule 3 (contrary rights).

subsection.content: The provisions of Division IX of Part II (general provisions relating to the Copyright Tribunal) apply in relation to the Tribunal when exercising any jurisdiction under this Part.

section.name: s234
section.heading: Qualifying person
section.leadIn: In this Part qualifying person (合資格的人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an individual domiciled or resident or having a right of abode in Hong Kong or elsewhere; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a body incorporated under the law of any country, territory or area,

section.name: s235
section.heading: Ships, aircraft and hovercraft registered in Hong Kong
section.content: This Part applies to things done on a ship, aircraft or hovercraft registered under the law of Hong Kong as it applies to things done in Hong Kong.

section.name: s236
section.heading: Denial of protection to people of countries, etc. not giving adequate protection to Hong Kong performers

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (5), if it appears to the Chief Executive in Council that performer’s rights of Hong Kong performers or fixation rights of Hong Kong qualifying persons are not adequately protected in a country, territory or area as a result of any prejudicial treatment given to those performers or qualifying persons by that country, territory or area, the Chief Executive in Council may by regulation in accordance with this section restrict the rights conferred by this Part in relation to the performances of the performers connected with that country, territory or area or in relation to fixations made by qualifying persons connected with that country, territory or area.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council shall designate in the regulation the country, territory or area concerned and provide that, for the purposes specified in the regulation, a performance given or a fixation made after a date specified in the regulation does not qualify for protection under this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a performance, if at the time of the performance the performer is an individual domiciled or resident or having a right of abode in that country, territory or area (and not at the same time domiciled or resident or having a right of abode in Hong Kong); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a fixation, if at the time of the making of the fixation, the maker is—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an individual domiciled or resident or having a right of abode in that country, territory or area (and not at the same time domiciled or resident or having a right of abode in Hong Kong); or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body incorporated under the law of that country, territory or area,

subsection.continued: and the regulation may make such provision for all the purposes of this Part or for such purposes as are specified in the regulation, and either generally or in relation to such class of cases as are specified in the regulation, having regard to the nature and extent of that prejudicial treatment referred to in subsection (1).

subsection.def: In this section Hong Kong performers (香港表演者) means a performer who is an individual domiciled or resident or having a right of abode in Hong Kong.

def.name: HongKongQualifyingPersons
def.leadIn: In this section Hong Kong qualifying persons (香港合資格的人) means a qualifying person who is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an individual domiciled or resident or having a right of abode in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a body incorporated under the law of Hong Kong.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council shall not exercise his power under this section in relation to a country, territory or area which is a party to a bilateral or multilateral copyright or related right convention to which Hong Kong is also a party or the application of which has been extended to Hong Kong.

section.name: s237
section.heading: Transitional provisions and savings
section.content: Schedule 3 contains transitional provisions and savings relating to performances given and acts or events occurring, before the commencement of this Part, and otherwise with respect to the operation of the provisions of this Part.

section.name: s238
section.heading: Expressions having same meaning as in copyright provisions

subsection.content: The following expressions have the same meaning in this Part as in Part II (copyright)—
article in transit;
authorized officer;
broadcast;
business;
cable programme;
cable programme service;
Commissioner;
communication to the public; (Added 16 of 2022 s. 86)
Copyright Tribunal;
export;
film;
import;
literary work;
published; and
sound recording.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.def: In sections 207(1A), 211(1A) and 228(1A), dealing in (經營) includes buying, selling, letting for hire, importing, exporting and distributing.(Added 64 of 2000 s. 15)

subsection.content: The provisions of section 8(3) to (5), sections 9(4) and 27(4) (supplementary provisions relating to broadcasting and cable programme services) apply for the purposes of this Part, and in relation to an infringement of the rights conferred by this Part, as they apply for the purposes of Part II and in relation to an infringement of copyright.

section.name: s239
section.heading: Index of defined expressions
section.content:
The following Table shows provisions defining or otherwise explaining expressions used in this Part (other than provisions defining or explaining an expression used only in the same section)—

division.name: D2
division.heading: Rights in Performances: Permitted Acts

section.name: s240
section.heading: Introductory

subsection.content: The provisions of this Division specify acts which may be done in relation to a performance or fixation notwithstanding the rights conferred by this Part; they relate only to the question of infringement of those rights and do not affect any other right or obligation restricting the doing of any of the specified acts.

In determining whether an act specified in this Division may be done in relation to a performance or fixation notwithstanding the rights conferred by this Part, the primary consideration is that the act does not conflict with a normal exploitation of the performance or fixation by the rights owner of the rights conferred by this Part and does not unreasonably prejudice the legitimate interests of the rights owner of those rights.
No inference is to be drawn from the description of any act which may by virtue of this Division be done without infringing the rights conferred by this Part as to the scope of those rights.

The provisions of this Division are to be construed independently of each other, so that the fact that an act does not fall within one provision does not mean that it is not covered by another provision.

section.name: s241
section.heading: Criticism, review, quotation, and reporting and commenting on current events

subsection.content: Fair dealing with a performance or fixation for the purpose of criticism or review of the performance or fixation or another performance or fixation, or of a work, does not infringe any of the rights conferred by this Part if the performance or fixation has been released or communicated to the public.

subsection.leadIn: The rights conferred by this Part are not infringed by the use of a quotation from a performance or fixation (whether for the purpose of criticism, review or otherwise) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the performance or fixation has been released or communicated to the public;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the use of the quotation is fair dealing with the performance or fixation; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the extent of the quotation is no more than is required by the specific purpose for which it is used.

subsection.content: Fair dealing with a performance or fixation for the purpose of reporting or commenting on current events does not infringe any of the rights conferred by this Part.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether any dealing with a performance or fixation is fair dealing under subsection (1), (2)(b) or (3), the court must take into account all the circumstances of the case and, in particular—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the nature of the performance or fixation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount and substantiality of the portion dealt with in relation to the performance or fixation as a whole; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the effect of the dealing on the potential market for, or value of, the performance or fixation.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a performance has been released to the public if it has been held in the public live, or provided to the public by any means (other than by communication to the public), including—

subparagraph.content: the issue of a fixation of the performance to the public;
the rental of a fixation of the performance to the public; and
the playing or showing of a fixation of the performance in public;

paragraph.name: b

subparagraph.content: the issue of the fixation to the public;
the rental of the fixation to the public; and
the playing or showing of the fixation in public; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in determining whether a performance or fixation has been released or communicated to the public, no account is to be taken of any unauthorized act.

subsection.content: Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 39.

section.name: s241A
section.heading: Parody, satire, caricature and pastiche

subsection.content: Fair dealing with a performance or fixation for the purpose of parody, satire, caricature or pastiche does not infringe any of the rights conferred by this Part.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether any dealing with a performance or fixation is fair dealing under subsection (1), the court must take into account all the circumstances of the case and, in particular—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the nature of the performance or fixation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount and substantiality of the portion dealt with in relation to the performance or fixation as a whole; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the effect of the dealing on the potential market for, or value of, the performance or fixation.

subsection.content: Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 39A.

section.name: s242
section.heading: Incidental inclusion of performance or fixation

subsection.content: The rights conferred by this Part are not infringed by the incidental inclusion of a performance or fixation in a sound recording, film, broadcast or cable programme.

Those rights are also not infringed by anything done in relation to copies of, or the playing, showing or communicating to the public of, anything whose making was, by virtue of subsection (1), not an infringement of those rights. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 90)

A performance or fixation so far as it consists of music, or words spoken or sung with music, is not regarded as incidentally included in a sound recording, broadcast or cable programme if it is deliberately included.
Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 40.

section.name: s242A
section.heading: Fair dealing for purposes of giving or receiving instruction

subsection.content: Fair dealing with a performance or fixation by or on behalf of a teacher or by a pupil for the purposes of giving or receiving instruction in a specified course of study provided by an educational establishment does not infringe any of the rights conferred by this Part.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether any dealing with a performance or fixation is fair dealing under subsection (1), the court shall take into account all the circumstances of the case and, in particular—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the nature of the performance or fixation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount and substantiality of the portion dealt with in relation to the performance or fixation as a whole; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the effect of the dealing on the potential market for or value of the performance or fixation.

subsection.leadIn: Where a fixation which apart from this section would be an infringing fixation is made in accordance with this section but is subsequently dealt with, it is to be treated as an infringing fixation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of that dealing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that dealing infringes any of the rights conferred by this Part, for all subsequent purposes.

subsection.leadIn: Where any dealing with a fixation involves the communication of the fixation through a wire or wireless network wholly or partly controlled by an educational establishment— (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 91)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the educational establishment fails to—

subparagraph.name: i
