subparagraph.content: adopt technological measures to restrict access to the fixation through the network so that the fixation is communicated only to persons who need to use the fixation for the purposes of giving or receiving instruction in the specified course of study in question or for the purposes of maintaining or managing the network; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: ensure that the fixation is not stored in the network for a period longer than is necessary for the purposes of giving or receiving instruction in the specified course of study in question or, in any event, for a period longer than 12 consecutive months,

paragraph.continued: the dealing is not fair dealing under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the educational establishment—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: adopts technological measures to restrict access to the fixation through the network so that the fixation is communicated only to persons who need to use the fixation for the purposes of giving or receiving instruction in the specified course of study in question or for the purposes of maintaining or managing the network; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: ensures that the fixation is not stored in the network for a period longer than is necessary for the purposes of giving or receiving instruction in the specified course of study in question or, in any event, for a period longer than 12 consecutive months,

paragraph.continued: subsection (2) applies in determining whether the dealing is fair dealing under subsection (1). (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 91)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3), a fixation is dealt with if it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: possessed, shown or played in public or distributed (otherwise than for the purposes mentioned in subsection (1)) for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sold or let for hire, or offered or exposed for sale or hire. (Added 16 of 2022 s. 91)

subsection.content: Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 41A.

section.name: s243
section.heading: Things done for purposes of instruction or examination

subsection.content: The rights conferred by this Part are not infringed by the copying of a fixation of a performance, to a reasonable extent, in the course of instruction, or of preparation for instruction, in the making of films or film sound-tracks, if the copying is done by a person giving or receiving instruction.

subsection.leadIn: The rights conferred by this Part are not infringed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the copying of a fixation of a performance for the purposes of setting or answering the questions in an examination; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by anything done for the purposes of an examination by way of communicating the questions to the candidates.

subsection.content: Where a fixation which would otherwise be an infringing fixation is made in accordance with this section but is subsequently dealt with, it is treated as an infringing fixation for the purposes of that dealing, and if that dealing infringes any right conferred by this Part, for all subsequent purposes. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 92)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3), a fixation is dealt with if it is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: sold or let for hire, or offered or exposed for sale or hire; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: communicated to the public, unless that communication is not an infringement of the rights conferred by this Part under subsection (2)(b). (Added 16 of 2022 s. 92)

subsection.content: Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 41.

section.name: s244
section.heading: Playing or showing sound recording, film, broadcast or cable programme at educational establishment

subsection.content: The playing or showing of a sound recording, film, broadcast or cable programme at an educational establishment for the purposes of instruction before an audience consisting wholly or mainly of teachers and pupils at the establishment, parents or guardians of pupils at the establishment, and other persons directly connected with the activities of the establishment is not a playing or showing of a performance in public for the purposes of infringement of the rights conferred by this Part. (Amended 15 of 2007 s. 62)
Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 43.

section.name: s245
section.heading: Recording, copying or communication by educational establishments: broadcasts or cable programmes

subsection.content: A recording of a broadcast or cable programme, or a copy of such a recording, may be made by or on behalf of an educational establishment for the educational purposes of that establishment without thereby infringing any of the rights conferred by this Part in relation to any performance or fixation included in it.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: A person authorized by an educational establishment may, without infringing the rights conferred by this Part, communicate to an authorized recipient a recording, or a copy of a recording, of a broadcast or cable programme that has been made in accordance with subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person makes the communication for the educational purposes of the establishment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the establishment takes all reasonable steps to ensure that—

subparagraph.content: only authorized recipients receive the communication; and
the authorized recipients do not make any copy or further transmission of the communication. (Added 16 of 2022 s. 93)

subsection.content: Recording, copying or communicating to authorized recipients is not authorized by this section if, or to the extent that, licences under licensing schemes are available authorizing the recording, copying or communication in question and the person making the recording, copies or communication in question knew or ought to have been aware of that fact. (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 93)

Where a recording or copy which would otherwise be an infringing fixation is made in accordance with this section but is subsequently dealt with, it is treated as an infringing fixation for the purposes of that dealing, and if that dealing infringes any right conferred by this Part, for all subsequent purposes. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 93)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3), a recording or copy is dealt with if it is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: sold or let for hire, or offered or exposed for sale or hire; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: communicated to the public, unless that communication is not an infringement of the rights conferred by this Part under subsection (1A). (Added 16 of 2022 s. 93)

subsection.content: Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 44.

section.name: s245A
section.heading: Copying or communication by educational establishments: published sound recordings or films

subsection.content: The making of a copy of part of a published sound recording or film by or on behalf of an educational establishment for the educational purposes of the establishment does not infringe any of the rights conferred by this Part in relation to any performance or fixation included in it.

subsection.leadIn: A person authorized by an educational establishment may, without infringing the rights conferred by this Part, communicate to an authorized recipient a copy of part of a published sound recording or film that has been made in accordance with subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person makes the communication for the educational purposes of the establishment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the establishment takes all reasonable steps to ensure that—

subparagraph.content: only authorized recipients receive the communication; and
the authorized recipients do not make any copy or further transmission of the communication.

subsection.content: Copying or communicating to authorized recipients is not authorized by this section if, or to the extent that, licences under licensing schemes are available authorizing the copying or communication in question and the person making the copies or communication in question knew or ought to have been aware of that fact.

Where a copy that would otherwise be an infringing fixation is made in accordance with this section but is subsequently dealt with, it is to be treated as an infringing fixation for the purposes of that dealing, and if that dealing infringes any right conferred by this Part, for all subsequent purposes.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4), a copy is dealt with if it is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: sold or let for hire, or offered or exposed for sale or hire; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: communicated to the public, unless that communication is not an infringement of the rights conferred by this Part under subsection (2).

subsection.content: Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 45.

section.name: s245B
section.heading: Communication, playing or showing by librarians, curators or archivists: sound recordings or films

subsection.content: The communication of a sound recording or film made by the librarian, curator or archivist of a specified library, museum or archive under section 51A to the users or staff of the library, museum or archive, by making it available online to be accessed through the use of a computer terminal installed within the premises of the library, museum or archive, does not infringe any of the rights conferred by this Part in relation to any performance or fixation included in it.

The playing or showing by the librarian, curator or archivist of a specified library, museum or archive under section 52A of a sound recording or film held in the permanent collection of the library, museum or archive to an audience consisting of members of the public within the premises of the library, museum or archive does not infringe any of the rights conferred by this Part in relation to any performance or fixation included in it.

The communication, playing or showing of a sound recording or film is not authorized by this section if, or to the extent that, licences under licensing schemes are available authorizing the communication, playing or showing in question and the person communicating, playing or showing the sound recording or film in question knew or ought to have been aware of that fact.
Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in sections 51A and 52A.

section.name: s246
section.heading: Copying by librarians, curators or archivists: articles of cultural or historical importance

subsection.content: The librarian, curator or archivist of a specified library, museum or archive may make a copy of an article of cultural or historical importance or interest and deposit the copy at the library, museum or archive without infringing any right conferred by this Part in respect of that article if the article is likely to be lost to Hong Kong through sale or export. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 95)
Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 53.

section.name: s246A
section.heading: Fair dealing for purposes of public administration

subsection.content: Fair dealing with a performance or fixation by the Government, the Executive Council, the Judiciary or any District Council for the purposes of efficient administration of urgent business does not infringe any of the rights conferred by this Part.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether any dealing with a performance or fixation is fair dealing under subsection (1), the court shall take into account all the circumstances of the case and, in particular—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the nature of the performance or fixation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount and substantiality of the portion dealt with in relation to the performance or fixation as a whole; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the effect of the dealing on the potential market for or value of the performance or fixation.

subsection.leadIn: Where a fixation which apart from this section would be an infringing fixation is made in accordance with this section but is subsequently dealt with, it is to be treated as an infringing fixation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of that dealing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if that dealing infringes any of the rights conferred by this Part, for all subsequent purposes.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3), a fixation is dealt with if it is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: possessed, shown or played in public or distributed (otherwise than for the purposes mentioned in subsection (1)) for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sold or let for hire, or offered or exposed for sale or hire. (Added 16 of 2022 s. 96)

subsection.content: Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 54A.

section.name: s246B
section.heading: Legislative Council

subsection.leadIn: The rights conferred by this Part are not infringed by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: anything done for the purposes of the proceedings of the Legislative Council or for the purposes of reporting such proceedings; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: anything done by or on behalf of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the members of the Legislative Council; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: The Legislative Council Commission,

paragraph.continued: for the purposes of the exercise and discharge by the Legislative Council of its powers and functions.

subsection.content: Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 54B.

section.name: s247
section.heading: Judicial proceedings

subsection.content: The rights conferred by this Part are not infringed by anything done for the purposes of judicial proceedings or for the purpose of reporting such proceedings. (Amended 15 of 2007 s. 64)
Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 54.

section.name: s248
section.heading: Statutory inquiries

subsection.content: The rights conferred by this Part are not infringed by anything done for the purposes of the proceedings of a statutory inquiry or for the purpose of reporting any such proceedings held in public.
Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 55.

section.name: s249
section.heading: Public records

subsection.content: Material which is comprised in public records which are open to public inspection may be copied, and a copy may be supplied to any person without infringing any right conferred by this Part.
Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 58.

section.name: s250
section.heading: Acts done under statutory authority

subsection.content: Where the doing of a particular act is specifically authorized by an Ordinance, whenever enacted, then, unless the Ordinance provides otherwise, the doing of that act does not infringe the rights conferred by this Part.
Nothing in this section is to be construed as excluding any defence of statutory authority otherwise available under or by virtue of any Ordinance.
Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 59.

section.name: s251
section.heading: Transfer of fixations of performances in electronic form

subsection.content: This section applies where a fixation of a performance in electronic form (other than such a fixation which was made available to the public) has been purchased on terms which, expressly or impliedly or by virtue of any rule of law, allow the purchaser to make further fixations in connection with his use of the fixation.

subsection.leadIn: If there are no express terms—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prohibiting the transfer of the fixation by the purchaser, imposing obligations which continue after a transfer, prohibiting the assignment of any consent or terminating any consent on a transfer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing for the terms on which a transferee may do the things which the purchaser was permitted to do,

subsection.continued: anything which the purchaser was allowed to do may also be done by a transferee without infringement of the rights conferred by this Part, but any fixation made by the purchaser which is not also transferred is to be treated as an infringing fixation for all purposes after the transfer.

subsection.content: Subsection (2) applies where the original purchased fixation is no longer usable and what is transferred is a further copy used in its place.
The above provisions also apply on a subsequent transfer, with the substitution for references in subsection (2) to the purchaser of references to the subsequent transferor.
This section does not apply in relation to a fixation purchased before the commencement of this Part.
Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 64.

section.name: s252
section.heading: Certain copying permitted when performances communicated to the public
section.content: The rights conferred by this Part in a fixed performance are not infringed by the copying of a fixation which is reasonably required for the viewing or listening of the fixation by a member of the public to whom the fixation is communicated provided that such act does not conflict with a normal exploitation of the fixation and does not unreasonably prejudice the legitimate interests of the performer or the person who has fixation rights in relation to the performance.

section.name: s252A
section.heading: Temporary reproduction by service providers

subsection.leadIn: The rights conferred by this Part in a fixed performance are not infringed by the making and storage of a copy of a fixation by a service provider if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the sole purpose of the making and storage is to enable more efficient transmission of the fixation by the provider through a network;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the making and storage forms an automatic and essential part of a technological process, and that process neither modifies the fixation, nor interferes with the lawful use of technology to obtain data on the use of the fixation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the storage is temporary;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the provider updates the database in which the copy is stored in accordance with reasonable industry practice;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the provider complies with conditions (if any) on access to the fixation; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the provider acts promptly to remove the copy or disable access to the copy in the event that either of the following facts comes to the provider’s actual knowledge—

subparagraph.content: the fixation has been removed from the original source from which the copy was made;
access to the fixation at the original source from which the copy was made has been disabled.

subsection.content: Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 65A.

section.name: s253
section.heading: Use of fixations of spoken words in certain cases

subsection.leadIn: Where a fixation of the reading or recitation of a literary work is made for the purpose—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of reporting current events; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of communicating the whole or part of the reading or recitation to the public, (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 99)

subsection.continued: it is not an infringement of the rights conferred by this Part to use the fixation (or to copy the fixation and use the copy) for that purpose, if the conditions in subsection (2) are met.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the fixation is a direct fixation of the reading or recitation and is not taken from a previous fixation or from a broadcast or cable programme;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the making of the fixation was not prohibited by or on behalf of the person giving the reading or recitation;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the use made of the fixation is not of a kind prohibited by or on behalf of that person before the fixation was made; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the use is by or with the authority of a person who is lawfully in possession of the fixation.

subsection.content: Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 67.

section.name: s254
section.heading: Fixations of folksongs

subsection.content: A fixation of a performance of a song may be made for the purpose of including it in an archive maintained by a designated body without infringing any of the rights conferred by this Part, if the conditions in subsection (2) are met.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the words are unpublished and of unknown authorship at the time the fixation is made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the making of the fixation does not infringe any copyright; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: its making is not prohibited by any performer.

subsection.content: Copies of a fixation made in reliance on subsection (1) and included in an archive maintained by a designated body may, if the prescribed conditions are met, be made and supplied by the archivist without infringing any of the rights conferred by this Part.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: designated body (指定機構) means a body designated for the purposes of section 70; and
the prescribed conditions (訂明條件) means the conditions prescribed for the purposes of that section,and other expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in that section.

section.name: s255
section.heading: Performance, showing or playing of works for purposes of club, society, etc.

subsection.content: It is not an infringement of any right conferred by this Part to perform, show or play a work (other than a broadcast or a cable programme) as part of the activities of, or for the benefit of, a club, society or other organization if the following conditions are met.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the club, society or organization is not established or conducted for profit and its main objects are charitable or are otherwise concerned with the advancement of religion, education or social welfare; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the proceeds of any charge for admission to the place where the work is to be performed, shown or played are applied solely for the purposes of the club, society or organization.

subsection.content: Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 76.

section.name: s256
section.heading: Incidental fixation for purposes of broadcast or cable programme

subsection.content: A person who proposes to broadcast a fixation of a performance, or include a fixation of a performance in a cable programme service, in circumstances not infringing the rights conferred by this Part is to be treated as having consent for the purposes of this Part for the making of a further fixation for the purposes of the broadcast or cable programme.

subsection.leadIn: That consent is subject to the condition that the further fixation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not be used for any other purpose; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be destroyed within 3 months of being first used for broadcasting the performance or including it in a cable programme service.

subsection.leadIn: A fixation made in accordance with this section is treated as an infringing fixation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of any use in breach of the condition mentioned in subsection (2)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for all purposes after that condition or the condition mentioned in subsection (2)(b) is broken.

subsection.content: Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 77.

section.name: s257
section.heading: Recordings for purposes of supervision and control of broadcasts and cable programmes

subsection.content: The rights conferred by this Part are not infringed by the making or use by Radio Television Hong Kong for the purpose of maintaining supervision and control over programmes broadcast by them, of recordings of those programmes.

subsection.leadIn: The rights conferred by this Part are not infringed by the making or use of recordings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the Communications Authority for the performance of its functions mentioned in section 9 of the Broadcasting (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 391); or (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: pursuant to the instructions of the Communications Authority in the performance of those functions. (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.content: Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 78.

section.name: s258
section.heading: Free public showing or playing of broadcast or cable programme

subsection.leadIn: The showing or playing in public of a broadcast or cable programme (other than an encrypted broadcast or cable programme) to an audience who have not paid for admission to the place where the broadcast or programme is to be seen or heard does not infringe any right conferred by this Part in relation to a performance or fixation included in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the broadcast or cable programme; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any sound recording or film which is played or shown in public by reception of the broadcast or cable programme.

subsection.leadIn: The audience are treated as having paid for admission to a place—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if they have paid for admission to a place of which that place forms part; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if goods or services are supplied at that place (or a place of which it forms part)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: at prices which are substantially attributable to the facilities afforded for seeing or hearing the broadcast or programme; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: at prices exceeding those usually charged there and which are partly attributable to those facilities.

subsection.leadIn: The following are not regarded as having paid for admission to a place—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: persons admitted as residents or inmates of the place which is operated by a charitable organization and the facilities therein are provided not for profit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: persons admitted as members of a club or society whose main objects are charitable or are otherwise concerned with the advancement of religion, education or social welfare and where the payment is only for membership of the club or society and the provision of facilities for seeing or hearing broadcasts or programmes is only incidental to the main purposes of the club or society.

subsection.content: Where the making of the broadcast or inclusion of the programme in a cable programme service was an infringement of the rights conferred by this Part in relation to a performance or fixation, the fact that it was heard or seen in public by the reception of the broadcast or programme is to be taken into account in assessing the damages for that infringement.
Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 81.

section.name: s258A
section.heading: Playing of sound broadcasts inside vehicles

subsection.content: The playing of a sound broadcast inside a vehicle primarily for the purpose of affording the driver of the vehicle access to public information (including but not limited to news reports, weather forecasts and information relating to road traffic) does not infringe any of the rights conferred by this Part.
Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 81A.

section.name: s259
section.heading: Reception and re-transmission of broadcast in cable programme service

subsection.leadIn: The rights conferred by this Part are not infringed by the inclusion of a performance or fixation in a television broadcast or a sound broadcast that is, by reception and immediate re-transmission without any alteration, included in a service provided by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a communal aerial broadcast distribution system within the scope of section 8(4)(e) of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an interconnection between a communal aerial broadcast distribution system within the scope of section 8(4)(e) of the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) and a subscription television network licensed, or deemed to be licensed, under the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106), where the re-transmission is for the reception of the users of the communal aerial broadcast distribution system; or (Amended 48 of 2000 s. 44)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a system licensed under a broadcast relay station licence issued under the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106). (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28; 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: The rights conferred by this Part are not infringed by the inclusion of a performance or fixation in a television broadcast or sound broadcast that is not encrypted and that is, by reception and immediate re-transmission without any alteration, included in a service provided—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a system licensed under a satellite master antenna television licence issued under the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106); or (Amended 17 of 2011 s. 28)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by an interconnection between a system licensed under a satellite master antenna television licence issued under the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) and a subscription television network licensed, or deemed to be licensed, under the Telecommunications Ordinance (Cap. 106) and where the re-transmission is for the reception of the users of the satellite master antenna television system, (Amended 48 of 2000 s. 44; 17 of 2011 s. 28)

subsection.continued: until the expiration of 6 months beginning on the day of publication of the notice in accordance with subsection (6). (Amended 36 of 2000 s. 28)

subsection.content: Where a television broadcast or sound broadcast is made or uplinked from a place in Hong Kong or elsewhere, and the broadcast is a lawful broadcast, then any person who, by the reception and immediate re-transmission of the broadcast without any alteration, includes a programme in a service provided by a system or an interconnection specified in subsection (1) or (2), being a programme comprising a performance, shall be in a like position, in any proceedings for infringement of the performer’s right (if any) in the performance, as if he had been the holder of a licence granted by the performer to include the performance in any programme so included in that service.

Notwithstanding subsections (1) and (2), where the making of the broadcast was in infringement of those rights, the fact that the broadcast was re-transmitted as a programme in a cable programme service is to be taken into account in assessing the damages for that infringement.

Where a television broadcast or a sound broadcast is not encrypted, the person who, by the reception and immediate re-transmission of the broadcast without any alteration, includes a programme in a service provided by a system or interconnection specified in subsection (2) is deemed to have been granted an implied licence by the maker of the broadcast to receive and re-transmit the broadcast using the system which is only revocable by notice given in accordance with subsection (6).

subsection.leadIn: The maker of a broadcast in respect of which a licence is deemed to have been granted under subsection (5) may revoke the licence by publishing a notice of revocation in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 1 Chinese language newspaper circulating in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 1 English language newspaper circulating in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: Expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in section 82.

section.name: s260
section.heading: Provision of sub-titled copies of broadcast or cable programme

subsection.content: A designated body may, for the purpose of providing people who are deaf or hard of hearing, or physically or mentally handicapped in other ways, with copies which are sub-titled or otherwise modified for their special needs, make recordings of television broadcasts or cable programmes without infringing any right conferred by this Part in relation to a performance or fixation included in the broadcast or cable programme.

Recording is not authorized by this section if, or to the extent that, licences under licensing schemes are available authorizing the recording in question and the person making the recordings knew or ought to have been aware of that fact.

subsection.def: In this section designated body (指定機構) means a body designated for the purposes of section 83 and other expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in that section.

section.name: s261
section.heading: Recording of broadcast or cable programme for archival purposes

subsection.content: A recording of a broadcast or cable programme of a designated class, or a copy of such a recording, may be made for the purpose of being placed in an archive maintained by a designated body without thereby infringing any right conferred by this Part in relation to a performance or fixation included in the broadcast or cable programme.

subsection.def: In this section designated class (指定類別) and designated body (指定機構) mean a class and a body respectively designated for the purposes of section 84 and other expressions used in this section have the same meaning as in that section.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Proceedings relating to Importation of Infringing Fixations

section.name: s262
section.heading: Definitions
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: detention order (扣留令) means an order made under section 264(1);

def.name: RightHolder
def.leadIn: right holder (權利持有人) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the performer of a performance in which performer’s rights subsist under this Part or the exclusive licensee of the performer’s economic rights in such a performance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person who has fixation rights in relation to the performance.

section.name: s263
section.heading: Application for detention order

subsection.content: A right holder may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order under section 264(1) where he has reasonable grounds for suspecting that the importation of an article that constitutes an infringing fixation of the performance in respect of which he is a right holder may take place. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)
An application under subsection (1) may be made ex parte but with previous notice to the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1) must be in such form as is prescribed by rules of court and must be supported by an affidavit of the right holder which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: states that at the time the application is made rights in performances subsist under this Part in the performance in question;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: states whether the deponent is the owner or the exclusive licensee of the rights in performances conferred by this Part;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: states that a copy of the fixation of the performance exhibited to the affidavit is an authorized copy of the fixation;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: sets out a sufficiently detailed description of the article in question to make it readily recognizable by the Commissioner;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: sets out particulars regarding the expected mode of transportation and the expected date of importation and, if available, particulars identifying the importer; and

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: sets out such other information and exhibits such other documents as may be prescribed by rules of court.

subsection.content: No application may be made under subsection (1) with respect to an article in transit.
No application may be made under subsection (1) with respect to the importation by a person of an article for his private and domestic use.

Section 121 applies in respect of an affidavit made in accordance with subsection (3) by the exclusive licensee of the performer’s economic rights that subsist in a qualifying performance under this Part in the same manner as it would apply if the affidavit were made by the owner of those rights.

section.name: s264
section.heading: Issuance of detention order

subsection.content: Where, on the hearing of an application made under section 263, the right holder presents adequate evidence to satisfy the Court of First Instance that the article in question is prima facie an infringing fixation, the Court of First Instance may make an order directing the Commissioner or an authorized officer to take reasonable measures to seize or detain the article on or after its importation.

The Court of First Instance may require the right holder to provide security or an equivalent assurance in an amount sufficient to protect the importer and any other person having an interest in the article to be seized or detained, including the consignee and the owner of the article, from any loss or damage that may be incurred in the event that the seizure or detention is wrongful or the article is released to the importer under section 265(6).
A detention order may contain such terms and conditions as the Court of First Instance considers appropriate.

The Court of First Instance shall not make a detention order with respect to any article that has been seized or detained by, and that is in the custody of, the Commissioner or an authorized officer pursuant to any law.

Where the Commissioner or an authorized officer seizes or detains an article pursuant to any law, other than this Division or Division VII of Part II, any detention order made with respect to that article ceases to have effect.
Where the Court of First Instance makes a detention order, the right holder shall forthwith serve a copy of the order on the Commissioner.

A detention order has effect from the date on which it is made or such later date as may be specified by the Court of First Instance and ceases to have effect 60 days from that date unless the Commissioner or an authorized officer has, pursuant to the order and within that period, seized or detained any article to which the order applies.

section.name: s265
section.heading: Enforcement of detention order

subsection.content: Where a detention order is served on the Commissioner, the Commissioner or an authorized officer shall, subject to the terms and conditions of the order, seize or detain any article to which the order applies.

subsection.leadIn: The right holder shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: supply to the Commissioner or an authorized officer sufficient information on the article and the particular importation to render the article recognizable and the shipment or particular importation identifiable and any other information the Commissioner or an authorized officer may reasonably require for the purpose of carrying out the detention order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: deposit with the Commissioner an amount that is, in the opinion of the Commissioner, sufficient to reimburse the Government for the costs likely to be incurred in connection with the carrying out of the detention order; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: upon notification in writing by the Commissioner or an authorized officer of the seizure or detention of the article, provide such storage space and other facilities as he may require.

subsection.content: The Commissioner or an authorized officer may refuse to carry out the detention order if the right holder fails to comply with subsection (2).

The Commissioner may, after giving written notice to the right holder, apply to the Court of First Instance for directions in carrying out the detention order, and the Court of First Instance may, after giving the right holder an opportunity to be heard, give such directions as it thinks fit. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner or an authorized officer shall forthwith after an article is seized or detained pursuant to a detention order, give written notice of the seizure or detention to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the right holder;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the importer; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other person to whom notice is required to be given by the terms of the order.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (7) and to any law authorizing the Commissioner or an authorized officer to seize or detain articles, the Commissioner or an authorized officer shall release any article that has been seized or detained pursuant to a detention order to the importer if the right holder has not, within a period of 10 days after notice of the seizure or detention is given to the right holder, notified the Commissioner in writing that an action for infringement in respect of the article has been brought under this Part.

The Court of First Instance may, on application by the right holder, after giving the Commissioner and each person to whom notice is required to be given under subsection (5) an opportunity to be heard, extend the period referred to in subsection (6) by a period not exceeding an additional 10 days if it is satisfied that the request for the extension is reasonable. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

In proceedings under subsection (7), the Court of First Instance may require the right holder to provide security or an equivalent assurance in addition to that provided in accordance with section 264(2). (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

Where the right holder has, within the period referred to in subsection (6), as may be extended under subsection (7), notified the Commissioner in writing that an action for infringement in respect of the article has been brought under this Part, the Commissioner or an authorized officer shall retain custody of the article subject to the direction of the court in the infringement proceedings.
No public holiday, gale warning day or black rainstorm warning day is reckoned in the computation of the period referred to in subsection (6), as may be extended under subsection (7).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: black rainstorm warning day (黑色暴雨警告日) means any day throughout or for part of which a black rainstorm warning is in force, and black rainstorm warning (黑色暴雨警告) means a warning issued by the Director of the Hong Kong Observatory of a heavy rainstorm in, or in the vicinity of, Hong Kong by the use of the heavy rainstorm signal commonly referred to as Black; (Amended L.N. 362 of 1997)

gale warning day (烈風警告日) means any day throughout or for part of which a gale warning is in force, and gale warning (烈風警告) has the meaning assigned to it by section 2 of the Judicial Proceedings (Adjournment During Gale Warnings) Ordinance (Cap. 62).

section.name: s266
section.heading: Variation or setting aside of detention order

subsection.content: The Commissioner or the right holder may at any time apply to the Court of First Instance to vary the detention order.
The importer or any other person affected by the detention order may at any time apply to the Court of First Instance to vary or set aside the order.

A person who makes an application under subsection (1) or (2) shall give to the other parties such notice of the day fixed for the hearing of the application as a judge of the Court of First Instance may order.
On the hearing of an application under subsection (1) or (2) to vary the detention order, the Court of First Instance may vary the order in such manner as it thinks just.
On the hearing of an application under subsection (2) to set aside the detention order, the Court of First Instance may set aside the order on such terms and conditions as it thinks just.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the parties to an application under subsection (1) are the Commissioner, the right holder and, if the article in question has been seized or detained pursuant to the detention order, the importer and any other person to whom notice is required to be given under section 265(5); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the parties to an application under subsection (2) are the Commissioner, the right holder, the applicant and the importer, if the importer is not the applicant.

section.name: s267
section.heading: Disclosure of information

subsection.leadIn: Where an article is seized or detained pursuant to a detention order, the Commissioner may disclose to the right holder—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the names and addresses of the importer, the consignor and the consignee;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the nature and quantity of articles seized or detained pursuant to the order;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any statement made to the Commissioner or an authorized officer by any person in connection with the seizure or detention, either with the prior consent in writing of that person or without such consent where the person is dead or cannot after reasonable enquiries by the Commissioner as to his whereabouts be found by the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other information or document relating to any article seized or detained pursuant to the order which the Commissioner thinks fit to disclose.

subsection.leadIn: Where the right holder seeks disclosure of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any information or document that is not referred to in subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any information or document that is referred to in subsection (1) but which the Commissioner has not disclosed,

subsection.continued: he may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order requiring the Commissioner to disclose such information or document and the Court of First Instance may on such an application make such order for disclosure as it deems fit. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2)

subsection.content: An application under subsection (2) may be begun by motion with previous notice to the Commissioner.

section.name: s268
section.heading: Inspection of articles, release of samples, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Where an article is seized or detained pursuant to a detention order, the Commissioner or an authorized officer shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: give the right holder sufficient opportunity to inspect the article for the purpose of substantiating his claim; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: give the importer an equivalent opportunity to inspect the article for the purpose of refuting the right holder’s claim.

subsection.content: Where more than one article is seized or detained pursuant to a detention order, the Commissioner or an authorized officer may permit the right holder or the importer to remove samples of the seized or detained articles if the right holder or the importer, as the case may be, gives the Commissioner or authorized officer the requisite undertakings.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), the requisite undertakings are undertakings in writing that the person giving the undertaking will—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: return the samples to the Commissioner or authorized officer at a specified time that is satisfactory to the Commissioner or authorized officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take reasonable care to prevent unnecessary damage to the samples.

subsection.leadIn: If the Commissioner or an authorized officer permits the inspection of any seized or detained article, or the removal of a sample, by the right holder in accordance with this section, the Government is not liable to the importer for any loss or damage suffered by the importer arising out of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: damage to any article incurred during the inspection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: anything done by the right holder or any other person to, or in relation to, a sample removed by the right holder or any use made by the right holder of such sample.

section.name: s269
section.heading: Costs payable

subsection.content: The Commissioner may assess the costs incurred by the Government in connection with the carrying out of a detention order and may deduct those costs from the amount paid as a deposit by the right holder under section 265(2).
Any costs assessed under subsection (1) shall be payable by the right holder to the Government and recoverable as a civil debt.

section.name: s270
section.heading: Compensation payable to importer, etc.

subsection.content: Where an article is seized or detained pursuant to a detention order and the article is released pursuant to section 265(6), the importer, the consignee or the owner of the article may, within 6 months after the date on which the order is made, apply to the Court of First Instance for compensation for any loss or damage suffered by him by reason of the seizure or detention.

subsection.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an article is seized or detained pursuant to a detention order;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an action for infringement is brought under this Part in respect of the article within the period referred to in section 265(6), as may be extended under section 265(7); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the action is discontinued, the claim of infringement is withdrawn or the court in the infringement proceedings determines that the infringement is not proved,

subsection.continued: the importer, the consignee or the owner of the article may, within 6 months after the date on which the action is discontinued, the claim is withdrawn or the court renders its determination, as the case may be, apply to the Court of First Instance for compensation for any loss or damage suffered by him by reason of the seizure or detention.

subsection.content: On an application under subsection (1) or (2), the Court of First Instance may make such order for compensation as it deems fit.

section.name: s271
section.heading: Rules
section.text: The power to make rules of court under section 54 of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4) includes power to make rules of court regulating and prescribing the procedure and the practice to be followed in the Court of First Instance under this Division, and any matter incidental to or relating to that procedure or practice, including rules prescribing any matter or thing that under this Division is to be or may be prescribed by rules of court.

section.name: s272
section.heading: Protection of Commissioner and authorized officers

subsection.content: The Commissioner and authorized officers are not liable for any loss or damage suffered by any person as a result of any action taken or omitted to be taken in good faith in connection with the carrying out of a detention order.

The protection conferred by subsection (1) on the Commissioner and authorized officers in respect of any action taken or omitted to be taken in good faith in connection with the carrying out of those duties shall not affect in any manner any liability of the Government for that action taken or omitted to be taken.

part.name: P3A
part.heading: Performers’ Moral Rights

section.name: s272A
section.heading: Moral rights conferred on certain performers

subsection.leadIn: This part confers the following moral rights on a performer of a live aural performance or a performer whose performance is fixed in a sound recording—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the right to be identified as a performer (section 272B); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the right not to have his performance subjected to derogatory treatment (section 272E). (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019)

subsection.content: The moral rights are conferred on the performer only if the performance is a qualifying performance.
The moral rights conferred on the performer are in addition to any other rights in relation to the performance that the performer or any other person may have under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

def.name: AuralPerformance
def.leadIn: aural performance (聲藝表演)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: means a performance which may be perceived by the human ear; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where part of a performance may be perceived by the human ear, means that part of the performance,

def.continued: and includes a musical performance, a spoken performance and a performance in any intermediate forms between singing and speaking;

def.name: SoundRecording
def.leadIn: sound recording (聲音紀錄)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subject to paragraph (b), has the same meaning as in Part II (copyright);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include a film sound-track which accompanies a film within the meaning of Part II.

subsection.content: The following expressions have the same meaning in this Part as in Part II (copyright)—
broadcast;
business;
cable programme;
cable programme service; (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 101)
communication to the public; and (Added 16 of 2022 s. 101)
published.
The following expressions have the same meaning in this Part as in Part III (rights in performances)—
fixation;
performance;
performer; and
qualifying performance.

For the purposes of this Part, if a performance of a musical work is conducted by a conductor, the sounds of the performance are treated as having been made by the conductor and the person who actually made those sounds, and a reference to a performer includes a reference to the conductor.

Section 204(2), (3) and (4) applies, with the necessary modifications, to references in this Part to the issue to the public of copies of a sound recording, as it applies to references in Part III to the issue to the public of copies of a fixation.

Section 205(2) and (4) applies, with the necessary modifications, to references in this Part to the making available to the public of a sound recording, as it applies to references in Part III to the making available to the public of a fixation. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 101)

part.crossHeading: Right to be identified as performer

section.name: s272B
section.heading: Right to be identified as performer

subsection.leadIn: A performer of a live aural performance or a performer whose performance is fixed in a sound recording has the right to be identified as a performer in the performance whenever—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the performance is staged in public or communicated to the public live; or (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 102)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the sound recording in which the performance is fixed is communicated to the public or copies of such a sound recording are issued to the public. (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 102)

subsection.content: The right of the performer under this section is, in the case of the issue to the public of copies of a sound recording in which the performance is fixed, the right to be identified in or on each copy or, if that is not appropriate, in some other manner likely to bring his identity to the notice of a person acquiring a copy. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 102)

The right of the performer under this section is, in any case other than the case referred to in subsection (2), the right to be identified in a manner likely to bring his identity to the notice of a person hearing the performance or communication in question. (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 102)
The rights of the performer referred to in subsections (2) and (3) include the right to be identified in a clear and reasonably prominent or audible manner.
If a performance is presented by performers who use a group name, identification by using the group name is sufficient identification of the performers in the group.

section.name: s272C
section.heading: Requirement that right under section 272B be asserted

subsection.content: A person does not infringe the right conferred by section 272B (right to be identified as performer) by doing any of the acts referred to in that section unless the right has been asserted in accordance with the following provisions so as to bind him in relation to that act.

subsection.leadIn: The right may be asserted generally, or in relation to any specified act or description of acts—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on an assignment of a performer’s economic rights conferred by Part III in a live aural performance that has taken place or is to take place or in a performance that has been fixed or is to be fixed in a sound recording, by including in the instrument effecting the assignment a statement that the performer asserts in relation to that performance or that performance fixed in the sound recording his right to be identified; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by instrument in writing signed by the performer.

subsection.leadIn: The persons bound by an assertion of the right under subsection (2) are—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in the case of an assertion under subsection (2)(b), anyone to whose notice the assertion is brought.

subsection.content: In an action for infringement of the right the court shall, in considering remedies, take into account any delay in asserting the right.

section.name: s272D
section.heading: Exceptions to right under section 272B

subsection.content: The right conferred by section 272B (right to be identified as performer) does not apply where it is not reasonably practicable to identify the performer.
The right does not apply in relation to a performance given for the purposes of reporting current events.
The right does not apply in relation to a performance given for the purposes of advertising any goods or services or making announcements of matters of public interest.

subsection.leadIn: The right is not infringed by an act which by virtue of any of the following provisions would not infringe any right conferred by Part III—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 241 (criticism, review, quotation, and reporting and commenting on current events); (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 103)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: section 241A (parody, satire, caricature and pastiche); (Added 16 of 2022 s. 103)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 242 (incidental inclusion of performance or fixation);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 243(2) (examination questions);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 246B (Legislative Council);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: section 247 (judicial proceedings);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: section 248 (statutory inquiries).

part.crossHeading: Right to object to derogatory treatment

section.name: s272E
section.heading: Right to object to derogatory treatment

subsection.content: A performer of a live aural performance or a performer whose performance is fixed in a sound recording has the right not to have his performance subjected to derogatory treatment.

subsection.leadIn: The right is infringed by a person who does any of the following acts—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a live aural performance, subjects the performance, or causes the performance to be subjected, to derogatory treatment when the performance is caused to be heard in public or is communicated to the public live; (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 104)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a performance fixed in a sound recording—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: causes to be heard in public or communicates to the public the performance by means of the sound recording in a manner which subjects the performance to derogatory treatment; or (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 104)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a performance which has been subjected to derogatory treatment and is fixed in a sound recording—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: causes to be heard in public or communicates to the public the sound recording. (Amended E.R. 2 of 2019; 16 of 2022 s. 104)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

def.name: Treatment
def.leadIn: treatment (處理)—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: in relation to a performance fixed in a sound recording, means any addition to, deletion from, alteration to or adaptation of the sound recording; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the treatment of a live aural performance or a performance fixed in a sound recording is derogatory if it amounts to distortion, mutilation or other modification that is prejudicial to the reputation of the performer.

section.name: s272F
section.heading: Infringing of right under section 272E by possessing or dealing with infringing articles

subsection.leadIn: The right conferred by section 272E (right to object to derogatory treatment) is also infringed by a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: possesses for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sells or lets for hire, or offers or exposes for sale or hire, or distributes,

subsection.continued: an article which is, and which he knows or has reason to believe is, an infringing article.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: InfringingArticle
def.leadIn: infringing article (侵犯權利物品) means a performance fixed in a sound recording which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been subjected to derogatory treatment within the meaning of section 272E; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been or is likely to be the subject of any of the acts referred to in that section in circumstances infringing that right.

section.name: s272G
section.heading: Exceptions to right under section 272E

subsection.content: The right conferred by section 272E (right to object to derogatory treatment) does not apply in relation to any performance given for the purposes of reporting current events.
The right is not infringed by modifications made to a performance which are consistent with normal editorial or production practice.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), the right is not infringed by an act done for the purpose of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: avoiding the commission of an offence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: complying with a duty imposed by or under an enactment.

subsection.content: Where a performer is identified at the time of the relevant act under subsection (3) or has previously been identified in or on published copies of sound recordings in which the relevant performance is fixed, subsection (3) has effect only if there is a sufficient disclaimer.

def.name: SufficientDisclaimer
def.leadIn: In subsection (4), sufficient disclaimer (足夠的卸責聲明) means a clear and reasonably prominent indication—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: given at the time of the relevant act under subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the performer is then identified, appearing along with the identification,

def.continued: that the live aural performance or the performance fixed in a sound recording has been subjected to treatment to which the performer has not consented.

section.name: s272H
section.heading: Duration of rights
section.content: The rights conferred by section 272B (right to be identified as performer) and section 272E (right to object to derogatory treatment) continue to subsist so long as the performer’s rights conferred by Part III subsist in the sound recording in which the performance is fixed.

section.name: s272I
section.heading: Consent and waiver of rights

subsection.content: It is not an infringement of any of the rights conferred by section 272B (right to be identified as performer) and section 272E (right to object to derogatory treatment) to do any act to which the person entitled to the right has consented.
Any of the rights referred to in subsection (1) may be waived by instrument in writing signed by the person giving up the right.
A waiver may relate to a specific performance, to performances of a specified description or to performances generally, and may relate to existing or future performances.
A waiver may be conditional or unconditional, and may be expressed to be subject to revocation.

If a waiver is made in favour of the owner or prospective owner of the right in the performance, it is presumed to extend to his licensees and successors in title unless a contrary intention is expressed.

Nothing in this Part is to be construed as excluding the operation of the general law of contract or estoppel in relation to an informal waiver or other transaction in relation to any of the rights referred to in subsection (1).

subsection.def: In this section, performance (表演) means a live aural performance or a performance fixed in a sound recording.

section.name: s272J
section.heading: Application of provisions to joint performers

subsection.content: The right conferred by section 272B (right to be identified as performer) is, in the case of joint performership, a right of each joint performer to be identified as a joint performer and must be asserted in accordance with section 272C by each joint performer in relation to himself.

The right conferred by section 272E (right to object to derogatory treatment) is, in the case of joint performership, a right of each joint performer and his right is satisfied if he consents to the treatment in question.
A waiver under section 272I of those rights by one joint performer does not affect the rights of the other joint performer or performers.

If there are 2 or more performers in a live aural performance or a performance fixed in a sound recording, the performers may enter into a joint performership agreement in writing by which each of them agrees not to exercise his right conferred by section 272E (right to object to derogatory treatment) in respect of the live aural performance or the performance fixed in a sound recording, as the case may be, except jointly with the other performer or performers.

section.name: s272K
section.heading: Application of provisions to part of performance

subsection.content: The right conferred by section 272B (right to be identified as performer) applies in relation to the whole or any substantial part of a live aural performance or a performance fixed in a sound recording.
The right conferred by section 272E (right to object to derogatory treatment) applies in relation to the whole or any part of a live aural performance or a performance fixed in a sound recording.

section.name: s272L
section.heading: Moral rights not assignable
section.content: The rights conferred by section 272B (right to be identified as performer) and section 272E (right to object to derogatory treatment) are not assignable.

section.name: s272M
section.heading: Transmission of moral rights on death

subsection.leadIn: On the death of a person entitled to the right conferred by section 272B (right to be identified as performer) or section 272E (right to object to derogatory treatment)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the right passes to such person as he may by testamentary disposition specifically direct;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is no such direction but the performer’s economic rights conferred by Part III in respect of the performance in question form part of his estate, the right passes to the person to whom the economic rights pass; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if or to the extent that the right does not pass under paragraph (a) or (b), the right is exercisable by his personal representatives.

subsection.leadIn: Where a performer’s economic rights conferred by Part III and forming part of his estate pass in part to one person and in part to another, as for example where a bequest is limited so as to apply—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to one or more, but not all, of the things the owner has the exclusive right to do or consent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to part, but not the whole, of the period for which the rights subsist,

subsection.continued: any right which passes with the performer’s economic rights by virtue of subsection (1)(b) is correspondingly divided.

subsection.leadIn: Where by virtue of subsection (1)(a) or (b) a right becomes exercisable by more than one person, the following provisions have effect with respect to the right—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it may, in the case of the right conferred by section 272B (right to be identified as performer), be asserted by any of them;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is, in the case of the right conferred by section 272E (right to object to derogatory treatment), a right exercisable by each of them and is satisfied in relation to any of them if he consents to the treatment or act in question; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any waiver of the right in accordance with section 272I by any of them does not affect the rights of the others.

subsection.content: A consent or waiver previously given or made binds any person to whom a right passes by virtue of subsection (1).

Any damages recovered by personal representatives by virtue of this section in respect of an infringement after a person’s death devolve as part of his estate as if the right of action had subsisted and been vested in him immediately before his death.

section.name: s272N
section.heading: Remedies for infringement of performers’ moral rights

subsection.content: An infringement of the right conferred by section 272B (right to be identified as performer) or section 272E (right to object to derogatory treatment) is actionable as a breach of statutory duty owed to the person entitled to the right.

In proceedings for infringement of the right conferred by section 272E, the court may, if it thinks it is an adequate remedy in the circumstances, grant an injunction on terms prohibiting the doing of any act unless a disclaimer is made, in such terms and in such manner as may be approved by the court, dissociating a performer from the treatment of a live aural performance or a performance fixed in a sound recording.

section.name: s272O
section.heading: Presumptions relevant to sound recordings in which performances are fixed
section.leadIn: In proceedings brought by virtue of this Part with respect to a sound recording in which a performance is fixed, where copies of the sound recording as issued or made available to the public bear a statement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that a named person was a performer in the performance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that a named group of performers were the performers in the performance,

section.continued: the statement is admissible as evidence of the facts stated and is presumed to be correct until the contrary is proved.

section.name: s273
section.heading: Interpretation of sections 273 to 273H

def.name: Circumvent
def.leadIn: In sections 273A to 273H, circumvent (規避), in relation to an effective technological measure which has been applied in relation to a copyright work—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: where the use of the work is controlled through the measure by an exclusive licensee of the copyright owner of the work, means to circumvent the measure without the authority of the exclusive licensee; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the use of the work is controlled through the measure by any other person who, with the licence of the copyright owner of the copyright work—

subparagraph.name: i

subparagraph.content: communicates the work to the public, (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 105)

paragraph.continued: means to circumvent the measure without the authority of that other person.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section and sections 273A to 273H, where a technological measure has been applied in relation to a copyright work, the measure is referred to as an effective technological measure if the use of the work is controlled by any person referred to in subsection (1)(a), (b) or (c) through—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an access control or protection process (including the encryption, scrambling and any other transformation of the work) which achieves the intended protection of the work in the normal course of its operation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy control mechanism which achieves the intended protection of the work in the normal course of its operation.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: technological measure (科技措施) means any technology, device, component or means which is designed, in the normal course of its operation, to protect any description of copyright work;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the reference to use of a copyright work does not extend to any use of the work which is outside the scope of the acts restricted by the copyright in the work.

section.name: s273A
section.heading: Rights and remedies in respect of circumvention of effective technological measures

subsection.content: Subject to sections 273D and 273H, this section applies where an effective technological measure has been applied in relation to a copyright work, and a person does any act which circumvents the measure, knowing, or having reason to believe, that he is doing an act which circumvents the measure.

subsection.leadIn: The following persons have the same rights and remedies against the person referred to in subsection (1) as a copyright owner has in respect of an infringement of copyright—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the copyright owner of the work;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an exclusive licensee of the copyright owner of the work; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any other person who, with the licence of the copyright owner of the work—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: issues to the public copies of the work; or (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 106)
communicates the work to the public. (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 106)

subsection.content: The rights and remedies conferred by subsection (2) on the copyright owner, the exclusive licensee and the person referred to in subsection (2)(c) are concurrent.

Sections 112(3) and 113(1), (4), (5) and (6) apply, with the necessary modifications, in proceedings in relation to the copyright owner, the exclusive licensee and the person referred to in subsection (2)(c), as they apply in proceedings in relation to a copyright owner and an exclusive licensee with concurrent rights and remedies.

Sections 115, 116 and 117 (presumptions as to certain matters relating to copyright) apply, with the necessary modifications, in proceedings instituted under this section, as they apply in proceedings instituted under Part II (copyright).

section.name: s273B
section.heading: Rights and remedies in respect of devices and services designed to circumvent effective technological measures

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 273E and 273H, this section applies where an effective technological measure has been applied in relation to a copyright work, and a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes, imports, exports, sells or lets for hire, offers or exposes for sale or hire, or advertises for sale or hire, any relevant device;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exhibits in public, possesses or distributes any relevant device for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: distributes (otherwise than for the purpose of or in the course of any trade or business) any relevant device to such an extent as to affect prejudicially the owner of the copyright; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: provides any relevant service.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—

def.name: RelevantDevice
def.leadIn: relevant device (有關器件), in relation to the effective technological measure referred to in that subsection, means any device, product, component or means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is promoted, advertised or marketed for the purpose of the circumvention of the measure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which has only a limited commercially significant purpose or use other than to circumvent the measure; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: which is primarily designed, produced or adapted for the purpose of enabling or facilitating the circumvention of the measure;

def.name: RelevantService
def.leadIn: relevant service (有關服務), in relation to the effective technological measure referred to in that subsection, means any service—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is promoted, advertised or marketed for the purpose of the circumvention of the measure;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which has only a limited commercially significant purpose or use other than to circumvent the measure; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: which is performed for the purpose of enabling or facilitating the circumvention of the measure.

subsection.leadIn: The following persons have the same rights and remedies against the person referred to in subsection (1) as a copyright owner has in respect of an infringement of copyright—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the copyright owner of the work;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an exclusive licensee of the copyright owner of the work; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any other person who, with the licence of the copyright owner of the work—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: issues to the public copies of the work; or (Amended 16 of 2022 s. 107)
communicates the work to the public. (Replaced 16 of 2022 s. 107)

subsection.content: The rights and remedies conferred by subsection (3) on the copyright owner, the exclusive licensee and the person referred to in subsection (3)(c) are concurrent.

Sections 112(3) and 113(1), (4), (5) and (6) apply, with the necessary modifications, in proceedings in relation to the copyright owner, the exclusive licensee and the person referred to in subsection (3)(c), as they apply in proceedings in relation to a copyright owner and an exclusive licensee with concurrent rights and remedies.

The copyright owner, the exclusive licensee and the person referred to in subsection (3)(c) have the same rights and remedies under section 109 (order for delivery up) in relation to any device, product, component or means which a person has in his possession, custody or control with the intention that it is to be used to circumvent effective technological measures, as a copyright owner has in relation to an infringing copy.
The rights and remedies conferred by subsection (6) on the copyright owner, the exclusive licensee and the person referred to in subsection (3)(c) are concurrent.
